Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Hotel in Downtown Montreal”
Reviews.Author: citrus1978
Reviews.Content: Very clean hotel with modern decor and beautiful bathrooms. Close to downtown shopping area.

Reviews.Title: “The only minus were the renos, if that's over you're all set!”
Reviews.Author: Adamo_Poeta
Reviews.Content: Stayed here due to proximity to McGill and convenience to shops/ restaurants. Upon check-in we naturally asked for something with a view, the response was it's hard to get a view these days in downtown Montreal - fair enough. We were given a room on the 7th floor - not too bad but not that great either: smaller room at the end of the hallway so the shape was a bit cut out, it had a window that covered 2 mini walls basically - this would be ok but as it was a very cold weekend the room was pretty chilly and turning up the heat did not do much. Little outdated TV was on the side of the bed but could not be totally turned to face the bed due to the wall blocking it. The view was of a large office building across the street. We knew there was construction happening and assumed it was all throughout the hotel because we could actually see and hear people working on the 2 rooms across ours. No biggie. However at about 6am we were awoken by some serious banging what seemed like a room above ours. We could not believe our ears or fall back to sleep so naturally I called the reception desk asking if there is construction everywhere and if we can be relocated: she responded saying "oh no construction is only on 7th and 8th floor!" Why on earth would someone give us a room in the middle of construction zone was beyond me! The lady was very nice and of course offered us immediate re-location which we accepted as we were staying 1 more night. The next room we were given: 21st floor! AMAZING view of the bridge, sky, Molson building in the distance, big screen TV, Internet etc... Totally made up for it! Overall staff service was very good, location is great, the only minus was the renovations and the first fellow who checked us in giving us a room in the middle of construction zone with no view when clearly better options existed. I guess the policy is if you first don't succeed ask again!

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch”
Reviews.Author: vttico
Reviews.Content: Our room (#1402) with great city-view balcony celebrated recent renovation...cool bathroom, comfortable platform bed, great lighting, EXTREMELY comfortable desk chair (where can I buy one?). Of course, the downtown location is incredible (nearest recommendations? House of Jazz: 1 block; Place des Arts/Jazz fest: 2 blocks; St. Denis St.: 5 blocks; Museum of Contemporary Art: 2 blocks; The Baie (2 blocks); Chinatown: 5 blocks; and on and on....) Gorgeous lobby with Yamaha piano, efficient elevators, friendly and effective front desk staff (cute, too!)

Reviews.Title: “Great room and efficient service.”
Reviews.Author: Late_Harvest
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed one night at the Delta for a weekend trip to Montreal, and would stay there again. After booking online for a "value" price, we were concerned we might receive a second-class room. This was definately not the case. We were pleasantly surprised to see that we were booked into a recently renovated room - it was very big and clean with modern furniture, and a huge bathroom. We were checked in and out very quickly. The desk agents were friendly and efficient, and there were no surprises on the bill. The underground parking fee was exactly as stated. For the location, quality of room, and good service, this hotel was a great choice.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff.”
Reviews.Author: Poppiesandchevre
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for a conference. Staff were great during the conference and made things comfortable. We were even sitting on the floor during a break out session and had a staffer find an extra chair. My room was clean and modern. Conference food was good, not exceptional. Great location for shopping and good for conference space.

Reviews.Title: “Very good to excellent!”
Reviews.Author: jpotz
Reviews.Content: Overall we enjoyed our stay as we were in one of the Signature suites and had access to the Signature Lounge. The layout and size of the of the room was good, and I liked the extra chairs and ottoman as I wasn't forced to watch tv from the bed. Maybe the TV could have been a little bigger as I think it was a 27". Some aspects of our room were outdated (wallpaper, artwork, tiles in shower) and they are going through renovations, so the rooms will be updated this year thankfully. With regards to renovations I didn't see, notice or hear any work being done which is a good thing...just saw the sign by the elevator. The gym is open 24hrs which is nice and the pool is open until 10pm. My only objection would be that there should be a adult swim time from 9-10 as there were a lot of children there until 10pm on a Saturday night. The staff members were friendly and very helpful and suggested some great places to eat. I would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Service”
Reviews.Author: babybeck
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Delta Montreal for 6 nights in February 2012. Despite them still renovating some of the rooms, our room was much larger than expected. We had a great balcony, although furniture would have been nice, to look out over the city on. The set up of the room made it seem less like a hotel room than most are. The service we received from all who worked there was exceptional. I would stay here again and again. It was also located within walking distance of some great places to eat and shop as well as between two metro stops.

Reviews.Title: “Grin and Bear it during the renovation”
Reviews.Author: Nedzer
Reviews.Content: I stay at this hotel a couple of times a year and I've always found the staff to be very courteous and helpful. The rooms are good sized and clean. I've always found it to be a good value and reasonably priced. Currently, they are undergoing a renovation and several floors are being torn up. When I checked in last week, I was advised that the contractors would only be working between 9 AM and 5 PM. Unfortunately, I was awakened the next morning to hammers pounding at 6:45 AM. Then, when I tried to shower, there was absolutely no hot water. This water was shut off for several hours. Naturally, I complained and I was immediately switched to a floor that was located further from the construction and, without asking, they had the room charge for that night removed from my bill. So, a potentailly unpleasant situation was defused and everything went smoothly with the rest of my stay. The staff is to be commended for handling the disruption caused by the renovation in a professional manner.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but needs a bit of updating.”
Reviews.Author: Skittle54
Reviews.Content: I paid a good rate for my room. Great location. Close to the subway and shopping areas. Friendly service. Accommodating. Cabs readily available. Only complaint was the rooms were a bit old and needed some updating. Also, there is no wireless internet in the rooms - only wired internet. So if you have a MacBook Air (like I do) you are out of luck. Wireless internet is available in the hotel lobby. Internet isn't free ~ $15 for 24 hours.

Reviews.Title: “No complaints!”
Reviews.Author: anonymoustravel
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a few days on a business trip. The location is nice, near McGill university and within walking distance of all the shops and restaurants up St. Catherine, etc. The room was pretty typical. I didn't really get to take advantage of the hotel's services or restaurant because of my busy schedule. The concierge was helpful in advising me on places to eat and arranging for a bus tour of the city. I was happy that there was a good size convenience shop within the hotel so I could always buy whatever I was missing (toiletries, snacks, etc.). There was a nice waiting area or lounge area (whatever you want to call it) right up the stairs from the lobby. The main drawback that affected me was the lack of free wireless Internet and costs to use the Internet. I did use the business center though, although it prints to the front desk. The front desk staff were quite friendly and responsive throughout. Overall it was a comfortable stay.

Reviews.Title: “New Years at the Delta”
Reviews.Author: Greg S
Reviews.Content: My wife, 2 young daughters and I stayed at the Delta on New Years Eve. We stayed in a brand new room , which was spacious, clean and very relaxing for all of us. Not one complaint about the room, or bathroom, our intent was to stay up til midnight, but we didn't make it, the beds were too comfortable. It is close to all amenities , shopping, restaurants, Ste Catherine St, Sherbrooke St.. parking was easy, in and out.. We requested and received, an early check in and late check out, surprising, considering it was New Years Eve , not to mention very affordable.The hotel was at capacity, however, we would not have known it with the service we received , the staff and management were amazing. The kids spent hours in the pool which was quite larger than expected, pictures can be deceiving, but not in this case, the whirlpool was also a big hit, and the gym had all the up to date equipment. All in all, we had a wonderful holiday in our own city, it was the kid's first stay in a hotel and was a wonderful experience, they want to go back, and we will definitely return, great family experience.

Reviews.Title: “MANN Grooming for Men - excellent choice for a spa in a city center”
Reviews.Author: Pawel_7
Reviews.Content: I went to the MANN Grooming for Men Spa, to relax after a long week. It was simply great. I received the massage I was looking for, within a reasonable price. Before leaving I tried the oxygen bar which was really fun! While inhaling my oxygen I had a chat with a gentleman, who was very happy with a haircut and straight blade shave he received. Definitely recommend this place! Oh yes, staff was amazing, very professional. Though predominantly for men they also have services for women that must be greatâ€¦

Reviews.Title: “Delta Montreal, a good place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: gina8668
Reviews.Content: The Delta Montreal was a good place to stay and a great value. My husband and I got a deluxe room. It was very large, clean and had the necessary amenities. I didn't give it 5 stars because the bathroom needs an update. The shower offered great pressure and was nice and hot, but the wall paper in the bathroom was tatty and dingy looking. The bathroom also boasted a wall phone, in case you needed to make a call while indisposed. This is a good place to stay if you are more interested in sight-seeing than a state of the art bathroom. I would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, central location”
Reviews.Author: DSophiaNY
Reviews.Content: The location was great, near the restaurants and mall. The highlight of my stay was being moved to a lower floor where the wifi actually worked. The restaurant located in the main lobby was great, the food was delicious.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay!”
Reviews.Author: Sweeti4027
Reviews.Content: First time in Canada and we stayed here for 5 days. It was very clean and the happy hour each day was a nice bonus. The service was friendly and I'd stay again!

Reviews.Title: “A little on the dated side, but good location and price!”
Reviews.Author: OnTyne
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked ourselves into the Delta Montreal as a "parents getaway" in Mid-October. After searching for something in Montreal that was centrally located, clean, but not a hole in the wall nor insanely expensive, we stumbled onto the Delta through AAA. Overall, it was a decent stay. The hotel is showing its age (ragged and worn carpet, cigarette burns, cracked and funky bathroom tile), but it's clean and comfortable. It's located relatively equidistant from two metro stops, is close to EVERYTHING (i.e., the malls, restaurants, McGill), and is a good stay. There were signs in the lobby showing the impending upgrades/updates to the rooms/hotel. I definitely look forward to staying here in the future! Can't wait to see what the updates are!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Needs Upgrade”
Reviews.Author: torontoguy2222
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here a few times, and have had a pleasant stay every time. The hotel's location is amazing; it's about a 1 minute walk to Place des Arts subway station. Perfect! Service was generally fine, and there is free wi-fi in the lobby, which is a nice bonus (other hotels charge $15/day). The gym is amazing! It's really quite big with several weight and cardio machines, and a free-weight area. The pool is long as well, which makes it good for doing laps. On a sour note though, this hotel is majorly due for an upgrade, and in fact it's undergoing some serious renovations right now. The renos are supposed to be finished in the Spring of 2012, so I look forward to it. Overall, good value.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in Montreal”
Reviews.Author: OttawaCA
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Delta Montreal in December for an overnight getaway. This hotel has a great location for shopping, restaurants, and sightseeing. It's a 10 to 15 minute walk or a quick taxi ride from the Via train station. It's an easy walk to main shopping strips on Sainte Catherine (The Bay,etc.) and Sherbrooke (upscale shopping) and not far from Old Montreal. The hotel is consistently good. I've stayed many times, and it's always clean and pleasant. They have a nice indoor pool. The bar is a nice place to go for a drink in the evening. The restaurant has a good buffet breakfast (but not cheap). I've never eaten dinner at the hotel, but there are so many restaurants close by. The rooms are about to undergo renovation in 2012.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good price”
Reviews.Author: Lau1967
Reviews.Content: I stay at the Delta every time I go to Montreal. Rooms are spacious, staff is really nice, location is perfect, walking distance to most places and really close to the subway. Hotel is being renovated. Gym is fine, there is a pool. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “An average Delta hotel”
Reviews.Author: KeepSmilingUK
Reviews.Content: I start with my tip for anyone planning to stay at a Delta Hotel: become a Delta Privilege member â€“ itâ€™s free and simple to join online. It gives you speedy check-in (usually at a separate desk) and late check-out without extra charge. Youâ€™ll also get free wired Internet access in your room (a great saving â€“ it could cost up to C$14 a day at most Delta hotels, and much more convenient than having to find a chair in the hotelâ€™s crowded lobby or restaurant, where WiFi is usually free of charge). On our recent escorted tour of Ontario and Quebec, we stayed at Delta hotels in Toronto, Montreal, Quebec City and Ottawa â€“ all somehow different but somehow decidedly average! The Delta in Montreal has a convenient location and the desk clerks were friendly and efficient (remember to say â€˜Bonjourâ€™ with a smile to get the best from them!). Itâ€™s a large(ish) hotel, with around 450 rooms, but quite pleasant because it managed to maintain the air of a smaller establishment. Our room was large but, unlike most other rooms here, it had no balcony. The decor was plain but acceptable and our two Queen-sized beds were comfortable. Lighting, as usual in modern hotels, was appalling. The air-conditioning unit was intrusively noisy; it seemed as if there was some sort of engine in the room. The bathroom, with tub, shower, wc and hand basin was spacious. It was clean and appeared to have had some redecoration - but peeling wallpaper rather let this down, as did evidence of a cigarette being stubbed out in the plastic hand basin (in this "non-smoking" room). On balance, this was a reasonable place at which to spend two nights, largely because of its staff and location.

Reviews.Title: “wery well situated and good value for money”
Reviews.Author: jakye
Reviews.Content: we stayed 4 nights at a very reasonable price, had diner one evening at the hotel - and this was excellent and not too expensive. Staff helpful. Situation very convenient to tour within downtown. Refurbishment planned will even upgrade the hotel

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home...”
Reviews.Author: Bueller007
Reviews.Content: I first visited this property in 2010, and have been staying there almost every time I visit Montreal. I grew up in Montreal (born and raised) and moved away from the city 7 years ago for a quieter life in Quebec's beautiful Eastern Townships one hour outside of the city. The big city does, however, remain close to my heart. From time to time I plan a weekend getaway to the city to spend time with friends, family, and even to watch a hockey game at the Bell Centre. Why do I always stay at the Delta Montreal? The explaination is simple... Let's begin with what's important.. The staff will make you feel like you're at home offering you all the comforts of home with a smile and a "can do attitude" to make you feel as if you're at home. This property is five star in every way. From the moment you're greeted with a smile by the staff at the front desk, to the comfortable, spotless rooms, one visit will prove to you why the Delta Montreal deserves your business. I've travelled the world over, and had the chance to stay at some of the most luxurious hotels in the world, but those are just hotels that take your money and send you on your way. The Delta Montreal offers you comfort, unsurpassed service, sport and fitness facilities, competetive guest reward programs, and all at reasonable prices. You don't have to pay top dollar to get the best, just give The Delta Montreal a try and you'll see. Everyone is a V.I.P. at this hotel. One staff member does consistantly stand out from the rest for her "over and above" efforts, and must be mentionned in this review: Catherine Dudoit (Guest Services Manager). When you visit this property ask for her... she will greet you with a smile, and will ensure that your stay is a memorable one. Give this property a try, and you will understand why I recommend this property above all others in the city... you WILL return!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: cewcil
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights at Delta Montreal Hotel and we bought it through a travel website. We had an upgrade to King bedroom and we had access to their Signature Club. It was a very spacious bedroom and the view from the balcony was beautiful. Staff were quite helpful and we had free internet too, unlike some other hotels that would charge $15 a day for wifi or internet. Some people reviewed that the hotel is outdated and a guest we met in the lift also complained about their internet. But our stay was definitely a pleasant one and I would recommend this hotel for stay in Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “No Complaints”
Reviews.Author: HobieHansen
Reviews.Content: Rolled the dice and used Hotwire and was given this hotel. It is a large sized hotel, that is a bit dated, but still remains a very safe bet. We stayed there on A Saturday night last March (2011) and were pleasantly surprised. The carpets and brass in the hallways and elevators were a bit stained and worn but once inside the room, everything was great. The beds were ultra comfortable, the room was nicely arranged with lots of space and we heard zero noise from the hallways or other rooms. I felt like catching up on sleep and staying another night. Not sure if this was because we were in an isolated corner of the hotel but with the comfortableness of the bed, blackout curtains and no noise, it was great. It is about a 20 minute walk from the Bell Centre, 10 minute walk to Cresent and another 15 minute walk to St. Laurent. If you want glitz and glamor, you won't find it here. But if you want a solid choice, for a decent price, we paid $90 on Hotwire, you can't go wrong with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for your money in the heart of the city.”
Reviews.Author: goodfellas17
Reviews.Content: Stayed on the 7th floor in a queen double. Been coming here for years. Pros: Accommodating staff. Large rooms for a downtown location. Super-comfortable beds and duvets, especially if you appreciate a firmer mattress. Broad pillow selection. Heater worked very well and hummed at a relatively low volume. All in-room lights worked. Good soundproofing between rooms and from the street. Oversized bathroom with plenty of counter space. Strong shower pressure, hot water within 5 seconds and a comfortable ergonomic shower head. Private balcony. Quiet part of town but one block away from the metro, shopping and Ste. Catherine. Cons: The 21" 1980s tube TV is way too small for the room. Remote control was well past its useful life with most buttons non-functional through rough treatment. Business chair easily tilts way back, not terribly practical or comfortable. In-room decor should be livened up. Very little to complain about. Look forward to the next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, clean, great views, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Helen M
Reviews.Content: Stayed the weekend of Nov. 12 2011 on the 22nd floor. Nice room (nothing amazing) - comfortable bed, flat screen TV. Bathroom was spotless - very important. Fantastic view - could see all the way to the river. Took advantage of the continental breakfast - even better view from the 23rd floor lounge. good breakfast, lots of choice, nice environment. Had a problem with my credit card - staff was very nice and helpful. used the parking garage, very convenient. Great location, short walks to all the great shopping on Ste.Catherine, Sherbrooke Street, museums, restaurants, cafes, metro, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but tired and dingy”
Reviews.Author: TO_TRAVELLERS_8
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Delta Montreal many times but not in the past few years but decided to go back for the location. It was our usual hotel of choice in Montreal. This stay was disappointing. The carpet was ripped in front of our room and the carpeting in the room was stained and dingy. The room was also right across from the ice machine on the 10th floor. We went to the front desk and they said oh that's the best you can get for the price you paid (we booked through the hotel, not through a discount site). Then he said since you are a Delta Privilege Member we will upgrade you to a higher floor and nicer room. He stated "think of it as a cadeau (gift)". We moved up to the 16th but the room was not any nicer. The room was still dingy with stained carpets (a few fewer stains than the other and freshly Febreezed) but the hook on the bathroom door was broken off, the fan was noisy and the bedside lamp was chipped. When we returned the previous room key, front desk asked was the new room better and we stated not by much. We were only staying one night and too tired to argue. Overall, this really turned us off the Delta Montreal which is unfortunate. There were signs all over the hotel stating there are going to be new rooms but not soon enough! Not worth the price when we booked through the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Its a delta”
Reviews.Author: ladybug269
Reviews.Content: I spent a night in this hotel with my husband and my mom. My mom was visiting us in Ottawa and we wanted to take her to Montreal for the night. Check-in was great, underground parking was very convenient and affordable. The room was really big, which was good with 3 people staying there. It had a nice little balcony too. Bathroom was large, which was a welcome change, bright and clean. The bedroom was clean and comfy, but maybe a little dated. The location was really good, 2 mins to the metro, 5 mins to saint catherines. Lots of cafes nearby for breakfast (i have a thing about never eating breakfast in a hotel if its nto included), and close to all the downtown action. We struck an online deal as well which made it very affordable for us (about $130 i believe, not sure what regular price is).

Reviews.Title: “spacious rooms”
Reviews.Author: prevostpilot
Reviews.Content: was here one day and when i opened the door to the room i was amazed at how big the room was very nice ...the bed so so comfy i didnt wanna get out along with the pillows...interior is a little dated but theres huge signs in the lobby saying that they are goin to remodel the rooms and if they do as the pics look then very modern

Reviews.Title: “Great service as usual”
Reviews.Author: famtimeOntario
Reviews.Content: This was our fifth stay at the Delta Montreal. Catherine at the front desk proved once again that the staff is always prepared to do all of the little extras to make our stay enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Great location.”
Reviews.Author: RockyCA
Reviews.Content: Great location, close to everything downtown. Rooms are clean but are in need of some updating, which they indicate that they have planned in 2012.

Reviews.Title: “On it's way to greatness”
Reviews.Author: neferTT
Reviews.Content: By mid-2012 when the renovations are complete, this hotel will be great. At the moment the room decorations/furnishings are a little dated, but the staff from Le Cordial (the bar) to Reception to Housekeeping were all friendly and extremely helpful, which made our stay really enjoyable. The hotel is a $38 taxi ride from Pierre-Elliot Trudeau airport and about $7 dollars from the downtown Via train station. We came in by train and avoided the parking charges. The hotel is just down the street from the Place des Armes metro station and we found that by buying a full day pass for $8 (you can also buy multi-day variations) we got around very easily on the metro. We found the breakfast to be a little expensive for our needs at the hotel but found many options nearby from the simple Van Houtte or Tim Hortons fast food to my favourite: Deli 500. It is open Monday to Saturday and can be quickly accessed from the outside door on the Mezzanine level of the hotel, next to Le Cordial. Just cross the street to the shopping plaza and follow the signs to the restaurant. Breakfast starts at $3.95 and is available all day ($2 charge for breakfast items after 11 am). We also took advantage of the on-site fitness facilities. There is a saltwater pool, hot tub, saunas, squash courts and a well equipped gym area, especially given that this is a hotel. Overall, the location was perfect for our needs, the staff extremely helpful and we would definitely return to the Delta Montreal again. Can't wait to see it after the renovations are finished!

Reviews.Title: “Glad I Got a Deal Through Hotwire”
Reviews.Author: truenic
Reviews.Content: The staff were great. Which helps make up for the fact that this hotel is drab and in need of a big overhaul. Like others, we had the carpet that had been worn to the underlay. The room was a sauna whenever we walked in so had to open the windows. (This is not to do with heat necessarily, but the humidity.) Housekeeping was good, no complaints there. Location was also good. We walked to pretty much everything. I would not pay more than $100 a night to stay here. Especially since we stayed at Le Westin the following weekend for $114.

Reviews.Title: “Long Stay In Montreal”
Reviews.Author: Yammy123
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Delta for about 6 weeks in September and October 2011, the hotel is centrally located in down town Montreal, close to Mount Royal, McGill University, subway, Place Des Arts and of course Catherine Street. The staff at the hotel is extremely friendly in every department, they go out of their way to make your stay comfortable. The beds are very comfortable with excellent linen, and clean washrooms, unfortunately the carpets in some room are in poor state for lack of update, while most are okay, however the hotel will be going through renovations floor by floor soon and finishing early 2012. The nice view rooms are at the far end from the reception side, these are the end rooms with room numbers ending in 23 and 24, the best views are from floor 13 and up and have small balconies. These rooms are spacious with king beds, the side rooms also have balconies with two double or queen but are very big and have balconies. The buffet breakfast is very good, lots of variety with local bagels (yum...yum...) The restaurant is a bit expensive with a standard menu. I would recommend go out to eat on the many sidewalk cafe's where the food is quite reasonable. The hotel also has two squash courts, pool, sauna and a decent gym. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time”
Reviews.Author: mmbookbug
Reviews.Content: We got a great price on our room in the Delta through another website and hope to get the same hotel another time. The location is terrific, it was clean and convenient, and all of the staff were very nice. On arrival I asked to see a couple of rooms and the receptionist advised me very well. Everyone was very child-friendly -- the receptionist gave our 6-year-old a little gift bag when we arrived, the housekeeper arranged her stuffed animals very cutely, and she was welcome to accompany me to the pool. We had a spacious room with a balcony and a nice little sitting area, which made it comfortable to have a couple of small meals in the room. The beds were OK, not as firm as we like but with nice medium-weight duvets and tons of pillows. The bathroom furnishing was not the most modern, but we don't expect everything to have been built or updated in the past 20 years, and the towels and toiletries were lovely. The carpet was not new and there were some old stains in the entryway, but it seemed clean. Internet access in the room is 16 Canadian per day and you are tethered to the wall (ethernet, not wireless), but we paid for it anyway. There is free wireless in the lobby but that isn't so convenient for families with young kids. There is an IGA 4 blocks away, handy and valuable given the prices even in convenience stores are. It took some time to find a parking spot in the garage on our Saturday night arrival due to a wedding being held in the hotel, but the rest of the time there were plenty of spaces. The price for parking seemed steep -- 26 Canadian per night -- but I'm not sure what the alternatives are. It was definitely nice to have the in/out option in addition to the Metro just a block away. The food in the hotel restaurant was good and the service was very friendly. The lap pool in the hotel is a great bonus for swimmers. I think the web site claimed three lanes and it was set up for two, but that was no problem when we were there on the weekend. It was a nice temperature and the changing room and fitness center were great. Apparently the hot tub was overheated, though -- we didn't try it but another guest had to call the fitness center assistant in to fix it, which must have taken some time. All in all a really nice experience. I am rating it a four because while the room was a great deal for what we paid, the parking and Internet fees added up and I would have minded paying extra for those on top of the hotel's regular rates.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Eriquita0115
Reviews.Content: I went to MontrÃ©al in mid-September, and chose this hotel because I found a great vacation deal on a different website. I was very happy with this hotel; the staff was very nice, accommodating, and knowledgeable. Also, the room was spacious, quiet, and big; I even had a room with a view of Mont Royal...very pleasant to wake up to every morning! The location also can't be beat - it's right by McGill University and about 2 blocks from the Place-des-Arts mÃ©tro station (and bus stops). There only two downsides: 1) Buying snacks in the hotel was a bit pricey (though I suspect this is pretty typical in the MontrÃ©al area); 2) It was difficult to manage the room temperature (it was almost always too hot or too cold). However, I would still definitely stay here again. Merci pour tout!!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Trinitygc
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in this hotel several times now for business. Its in an unbeatable location, right on Sherbrooke St. and steps away from shopping, McGill University and downtown Montreal. The rooms are nice, not spectacular, but the room does provide a nice restful sleep, which is especially important as a business traveller. The bed was really comfortable and the pillows are amazing. Bathrooms are nice, average for a big chain. Free wifi. My only comment, was that the remote doesn't reach the TV from the bed, but I'm sure this will be fixed when the hotel completes its major upgrade in 2012.

Reviews.Title: “Large, clean room, good value, close to most things”
Reviews.Author: hueyott
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Delta Montreal over the September long weekend and was pretty impressed with the hotel. For the price we had a good experience. Our check in was fast and helpful, our room was VERY large (4th floor) and very clean. The bed was comfortable. They had a "sun room/balcony" which didn't look like it was cleaned very often so we didn't go out there. That balcony was probably the only bad thing I'd say about the stay. We used the pool and hot tub, and they were great after a long hot/humid afternoon of walking around Old Montreal. We walked down to Old Montreal and it took about 15-20 minutes or so. Could've spent another $25 / night to stay at Centre-ville, but I don't think it was worth it, the President Kennedy location we were at was fine and the walk was quick. Check out was equally as fast and convenient, the underground parking was convenient, but at $26 a little pricey. However, the in and out ability of parking was nice. There's a little Jazz club around the corner "House of Jazz"... or something like that. If you're looking for a nice place for a nightcap near the hotel (1 block) try it out. Great atmosphere!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, smelly room”
Reviews.Author: teedotTraveller
Reviews.Content: While the location of this hotel was ideal, close to the train station, metro station, restaurants, shopping and great walking streets, it wasn't a place we wanted to spend too much time in. Our room looked nothing like the ones posted online. The lobby and public spaces of the hotel have been renovated, but our room remained dated and worse, smelly. It smelt like it had once been a smoking room and was still trying to deodorize the room with chemicals. Each time we entered we had to open up the balcony windows for fresh air, and then rely on the a/c throughout the night. The room size was okay, and the bathroom size was relatively large. It had a nice long counter, which is nice when you're sharing the room. Again, the fixtures were dated and the shower felt small and dark. The water pressure was fine, no trouble getting hot water. The balcony is hardly one I wanted to step out onto. It looked like there was bird droppings crusted on, and there aren't any chairs or anything to enjoy the outdoor space. The good part is that our room faced south, so it was quiet. Next time in Montreal, I'd consider staying elsewhere, or at least paying full price to get one of the renovated rooms. We booked a deal on hotels.com, not sure if that's why we ended up with an old room.

Reviews.Title: “Good value in Montreal”
Reviews.Author: Cara61
Reviews.Content: We liked the location of this hotel. Walking distance to Place Des Arts, Metro stations, St-Catherine Street,Shopping, McGill, Molson Stadium The room was spacious and clean. Plumbing does need some updating. Room rate was reasonable for Montreal. Did not use their restaurant but there are plenty of other (and most likely cheaper) options in the vicinity. Would go back again for a short stay or overnight to see a concert or a football game.

Reviews.Title: “Showing it's age?”
Reviews.Author: Chocolate_on_pillow
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a business trip for 4 nights. The place in general is quite run down and is in need of renovations. The TV is and older CRT and the remote barely worked from the bed - you needed to be near the TV, even with fresh batteries. The bathroom is spacious but with poor plumbing. The sink faucet was loud and had too much pressure while the shower was old, dark, and cracked. The gym facility was not bad and had some decent elliptical machines and treadmills with individual tv units.

Reviews.Title: “A place to shower and sleep”
Reviews.Author: SonyaL067
Reviews.Content: Not a great location, unless you're flying in or out of Montreal. To go to the oldest part of Montreal, we had to use the rental as it's not within walking distance. The room was clean, but average.

Reviews.Title: “Good location!”
Reviews.Author: AddickMark
Reviews.Content: Good location in walking distance of city centre and old town with its not to be missed Notre Dame Basilica. The rooms are cavernous and clean, the largest none suite rooms I have ever seen. Used the gym and pool which were good with towels supplied. The meals in the bar were good but pricey. Had the continental breakfast which didnâ€™t offer much choice.

Reviews.Title: “A good stay in Montreal”
Reviews.Author: B82
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel a couple of times for work, not longer than two days. I have chosen this hotel due to its proximity to McGill University. What I discovered is that it is centrally located downtown, and it's very accessible to many restaurants, shopping. It's a block away from Sherbrooke, and a couple of blocks from St. Catherine. Close to malls and restaurants. The rooms are very clean and comfortable. They offer excellent service to their customers. Recently, I left my laptop charger in the room and checked out. I phoned the following morning and they found the charger and graciously left it at the front desk for a friend to pick up. I will definitely stay at this hotel again, for business and pleasure trips to Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “valet very helpful”
Reviews.Author: lucilleOntarioCanada
Reviews.Content: We did not stay at this hotel, however have stayed at Delta hotels often. Walked in to get a map and help to find directions to a place. The valet knew that we were not guests there and took time to help us with great courtesy.

Reviews.Title: “Great Weekend Away”
Reviews.Author: vacatime81
Reviews.Content: After a long drive from Toronto, we arrived late at the Hotel, roughly around 10pm. We were greeted by Darrin at the front desk who was EXTREAMLY friendly and helpful. He was an absolute pleasure to speak with. We were informed as we were checking in that unfortunatly the hotel had over sold in the room type that we had booked. Darrin was very professional in dealing with this situation and even upgraded us to a club room on the 21st floor. We arrived to our room and were extreamly happy. Shortly after arriving to the room, Darrin from front desk called to ensure that everything was ok and up to our standards. This really shows that the employees at this hotel care about their guests. The bed was comfortable, balcony had a great view and the rest of the room was just as good. The only complaint that I had in regards to the room was that we found it a bit stuffy, no big deal though, we just opened the door for fresh air. Housekeeping was great, the room was very clean when we arrived. We had placed our do not disturb sign on the door in the morning when we woke up as we did not require housekeeping services. When we arrived back to the hotel later in the afternoon, we recieved a call from a very pleasent woman from housekeeping just checking that we did not require service because we had the sign posted on the door. I though this was nice as sometimes people forget to take the sign off the door and wonder why no one came. The hotel was in a great location and was walking distance to everything that we had wanted to do and see. The only thing negitive that I would have to say about the hotel is I noticed that the walls are quite thin and you can hear everything going on around you. We didn't let that bother us though. I will stay here again in a heart beat. Thank you Delta Montreal and Darrin on the front desk for the amazing stay.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury Feel”
Reviews.Author: MKovoor
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location -- walking distance to major shopping. Our room was really big and had a great view with a balcony -- it was nice to be on a high floor. Two of the lamps in the room did not work, however. Shower was leaky as well. On the plus side, the room was just so large and nice and quiet. Great for a family of 4. Swimming pool was clean and large enough but heavily chlorinated which irritated our eyes much more than normal. Hot tub was excellent. Really wish breakfast was included -- it was very expensive so we went down the street to a little cafe which was wonderful. Parking is extra -- that is typical of Montreal but annoying nonetheless.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoLikestotravel
Reviews.Content: the Delta on President Kennedy Ave. (there are 2 Delta hotels in downtown Montreal) is well located, roughly equidistant from Mont Royal, Vieux Montreal and Rue St Denis - walkable to all 3. The rooms are a nice size, beds very comfortable with white duvets, I think all rooms have balconies, but at least in our case, no chairs on the balcony. It has an office center with free internet, I wasn't quite clear if the rooms had free internet, a pleasant bar and a restaurant which we didn't try but was very busy. We bought at a bargain price and although we had a balcony as promised, didn't realize that the bargain rates were on the lower floors, so our room had no view at all. Still, we had a pleasant stay, enjoyed the free newspaper every day and the room had everything we needed, a/c worked fine, would definitely return if we could get a good rate again.

Reviews.Title: “Signature Club could be better value”
Reviews.Author: KenloToronto
Reviews.Content: If you need to pay extra for internet accesss and breakfast, you may consider the little bit pricy Signature club room. It provides a loungewith free cocktail from 5 to 7 pm. The internet + breakfast + cocktail may offset the price. Signature Club will be on 21st to 23rd floor (top floor) so you get a better view. Room size and quality are the same as other grades of rooms. The internet access is not wifi, the room provides a LAN cable to connect your netbook. If you want your iphone or mobile to get access, it won't work. There probably a way if you call the front desk. Parking is expensive and so is downtown in other cities.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and pool, spacious room, but needs renovation”
Reviews.Author: Canadian135
Reviews.Content: Excellent location for tourists, walking distance to art gallery, university, St. Catherine street, and metro. The pool is a good size, with a nice hot tub - our daughter really enjoyed the pool (which is closed from 10 to 11 am, and again from about 2-3 pm). The fitness area is excellent as well. The rooms are large (which is nice if you have lots of luggage) - our room had a balcony, and a large bathroom. Oddly, there were two double beds rather than 2 queen beds which is unusual - so a massive room with smaller than normal beds. As you can see from other comments, the hotel feels a bit worn/old - not up to normal Delta quality, although I understand the hotel will be renovated in 2012. If you can get a deal (we paid $129 a night, I believe) then it's worth it. The buffet breakfast was very expensive, but there's a nice and inexpensive cafe kitty-corner to the Delta. Parking is about $26 per day.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it at all”
Reviews.Author: Pratik V
Reviews.Content: The corridors smell, the bathrooms are grimy. There is a general sense of decay here which is a shame because Montreal the city is really charming and pretty. Maybe it will be a better hotel after the renovation but I would stay clear until then. I booked this hotel through their website so paid much more than hotwire or priceline. I wish I hadn't because I still got a room only on the 3rd floor "because I was checking in early and it was the only room available". A very indifferent experience save for the beds which are very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, easy to get to”
Reviews.Author: BCKL78
Reviews.Content: This was a fine hotel in a good location. Room was good-sized and had a balcony and underground parking with in and out privileges. Also close to the Metro. A solid choice for a downtown hotel that doesn't cost and arm and a leg.

Reviews.Title: “No 210 room is simply dirty .two bulbs were not working .the patio doors were filthy and the smell in the room terrible”
Reviews.Author: Moonsider
Reviews.Content: Room was not cleaned and the smell was terrible.two bulbs were not working and the patio doors were filthy . Aeroplan should not have this hotel on their lists.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely Out-Dated and Over Priced”
Reviews.Author: cloma099
Reviews.Content: Stayed here last weekend, what an experience! The first thing we noticed about the room was the amount of space. It was extremely large, and only filled with two little double beds. They looked and felt much smaller than regular double beds. I was there with 3 other people, and 2 decided to sleep on the floor since the beds were so little. When we called down to the front desk to ask for extra pillows and blankets, they told us, they could only spare 2. On top of that, it took a long time, for a miserable man, to deliver it to us. The room was extremely out of date. The balcony was empty, no chair no table, just concrete. There is no mini-fridge in the room. When asking the concierge for directions for a convenience store, they sent us 20 mins away, in a very sketchy part of town, when there was one just around the corner. Overall, a very dissapointing experience.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely need some major renos....”
Reviews.Author: ProudCanadianTravell
Reviews.Content: I was disappointed that the hotel room I stayed in was so old and the bathroom was so dark (no lights on top of the toilet!). I generally like Delta for business travels but would definitely not stay here unless renos are done to the rooms. the bed was also uncomfortable and i did not have a good night sleep for 3 nights straight. On the plus side, the service has been great.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: travelmum
Reviews.Content: I usually find Delta hotels good value; not top of the line, but nice. I'd stayed at another Delta in Montreal a few yeas ago which was nice; thought it was this one, but it seemed very different. We actually only stayed at this hotel, as other hotels I tried to book were full or very expensive, as it was the weekend U2 were playing. It was one of the few hotels where we could get a decent rate. While the location is central, it's a bit dirty when you come out of the hotel on the south side. Not the hotel's fault, but while safe, it's all a bit run down. The lobby of the hotel looked fine, but we were disappointed with the room. Very much in need of a face lift. worn, dirty carpets and old fashioned looking furniture. It was ok for one night, but I felt it didn't live up to the Delta's standards. Maybe we were given a cheap old room because we booked via a generic site, not the Delta's site, but still, wasn't good enough.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Getmet
Reviews.Content: Great location within walking of the Via Rail station. Restaurant food is excellent and service is great.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC -- A GREAT HOTEL!!”
Reviews.Author: TravelRoamers
Reviews.Content: One is always leery about booking hotels off the Internet. Are the reviews true when travelers rave; are the reviews true when travelers complain wondering how a hotel can stay in business. Are the photos accurate or photoshopped. Let me say this -- this review is true and I wish I had had my camera to take photos. The Delta Montreal was a fantastic hotel. It is in the middle of downtown and central to everything. A Metro stop is about a block away. Our room was huge with a large sitting area with two comfy armchairs with a small table in between. A good reading lamp sat directly behind the small table. The beds were so comfortable I slept like a baby. There was a balcony where you could go outside and watch the people below. There were also two other big windows giving the room a very airy feel to it. I saw photos posted by a traveler to the Delta Montreal in June 2011 that showed peeling wallpaper in the bathroom and it looked terrible. The first thing I did was checked out the bathroom -- large, clean, no peeling wallpaper (great shower). If you're into working out and swimming on your out of town stays, wait until you see the workout room and the pool. I have never seen one like it in a hotel. The pool is Olympic size and has warm salt water. It was great after sightseeing all day. I also have to mention the staff -- they were so helpful and soooooo nice. We were able to find some great places to eat based on their recommendations. I know I'm going on and on, but it was truly a great experience. And I was able to book a rate of $109 CAD per night. Don't hesitate about staying here -- it's well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “I've stayed there twice, and I would stay again!”
Reviews.Author: Bob2335
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a quiet area of downtown Montreal, but it sits only blocks from shopping, restaurants, pubs and museums. My wife and I walked wherever we wanted and never used a car or public transportation. We also felt safe 100% of the time. The only absolutely minute concern we had was that the carpet near the bathroom was in poor shape. That is the reason for the four out of five rating I gave. I had read about the carpet in earlier reviews about the hotel, but we stayed, anyway. It did not negatively impact upon our stay or our trip. No worries!

Reviews.Title: “We would not have stayed if we had been able to physically inspect the room beforehand.”
Reviews.Author: xfencer
Reviews.Content: After reading tripadvisor reviews, especially concerning the condition of the rooms, we considered changing the reservation, although we got a good package deal including the airfare. First, the positive - staff were very friendly and helpful, although the concierge on duty the last 3 days needs to be more enthusiastic. Lobby was nice, as was the dining area. Fitness room and pool looked very good, although we didn't find time to use them. The room location was great - in the rear of building and no rooms on either side of us, so it was very quiet (room 609). The king bed with pillowtop was great - we slept well, which is not always the case in our experience. I had requested a quiet location, and apparently was granted my request. The room was as described in many other reviews - carpeting was buckled in on place( I tripped over it several times) and looked dirty, one curtain was not hung properly, bathroom door had a hole on the inside, shower head only worked on one setting, sink drain stop didn't stay (was fixed after complaint),towel rack was loose (also fixed), furniture was dated and looked very worn and scratched, one lamp socket was hanging loose, phone was an old unit with no instructions, tv was an old model. There were holes in the balcony floor. I had also called a few days before we arrived to request a refrigerator, but it was not there when we arrived. My wife was shocked that I didn't demand a room change, but the room location and comfort of the bed were very important because of many poor previous experiences with noise. I discussed many of these issues with the general manager, a very nice young man, who explained that he was well aware of them, and received many calls from people who had read these reviews. He explained that they were going to be undergoing major renovations in the near future. It appeared, however, that the rooms were not being properly kept up. Some of the issues mentioned were correctable, and should have been taken care of before we checked in. The promise of future renovations doesn't mean you just let the place go until then. We know now why the room picture on the hotel website only shows the bed. Helene and Neil Boxer, Bayside, New York

Reviews.Title: “If you need to stay downtown its a good place”
Reviews.Author: nalana
Reviews.Content: My husband and I chose it bcoz its downtown , we have 2 kids , 2 yrs and 2 months . The room smelled badly and we had a balcony but it was dirty so we didnt use it

Reviews.Title: “Ok, but there is much better for the price”
Reviews.Author: MamaJojo123
Reviews.Content: Travelled to Montreal for 2 nights on business and was booked into this hotel through our company travel provider. I must say I was not really impressed with the condition of the hotel. Although it seemed as though there was an attempt to update the decor in the rooms - beds were great, nice bedding, newer artwork, the bathroom were very worn out looking, chipped tiles, sink and countertop. Carpets were very worn out as well as the wallpaper in the corridors. My collegue was on a different floor, but their room had a smoke detector dangling on wires from the ceiling, there was black "stuff" on the ceiling - not sure what exactly, but it didn't look clean. For business accomodation, it was pretty shabby. With so many choices in downtown Montreal, this hotel would not be on the top on my list, particularly given the cost per night.

Reviews.Title: “Not very happy”
Reviews.Author: rjincan
Reviews.Content: The hotel was fine. We were happy with the room and service on the whole, but had one significant criticism. We were put on floor 19 which is a smoking floor. Problem is we were not told it was a smoking floor when we checked in. We smelled faint cigarette smoke the first couple of nights but we figured it was a bunch of kids next door and weren't too bothered as the smell faded. No big deal. But on our third and final night the smell was much stronger and filled our room, making it quite unpleasant to be in there. I mentioned this at the front desk and was told that we'd been placed on a smoking floor. Why would this not be mentioned to us when we first checked in? My wife is heavily pregnant and I can't think why the person who checked us in didn't think to mention that we would be on a smoking floor. Not impressed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at the Delta”
Reviews.Author: gilboman2001
Reviews.Content: Booked the Delta on Priceline, but service was quick and efficient on checkin/out. Staff was friendly, though it was limited to only when I checked in, when I had to get an extra key cause I lost mine and checkout. Overall condition of the public common areas were excellent, room was good, it was large and spacious and clean. Yes the carpet probably could be changed, but everything else was very clean. Location was good, 15-20min walk to crescent street or old montreal and steps from the subway. Won't hesitate to go back even without a priceline deal! But the mattresses were a bit too soft for my liking and they're foam mattresses with pillowtop and not spring which probably would provide better support/age better.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic service - Would definitely stay there again!!”
Reviews.Author: bonnieboy
Reviews.Content: We arrived on Friday of the June 2011 Canadian Formula One Grand Prix weekend. Due to an error with one of the online booking services, the hotel was heavily overbooked. But, the Delta arranged a room for us at another hotel, called us a cab, and paid for the cab ride to the other hotel. The other hotel was fine and was actually much closer to the race track so that worked out great! The Delta staff even called us at the new hotel to be sure we got there o.k. and were happy with the room. Last night of our stay was back to the Delta, again with the Delta picking up the cab ride from the other hotel. Delta also upgraded our room to a mini suite and sent up a fruit basket and bottle of wine. So, bottom line is that what could have been a bad situation was handled expertly by the Delta hotel staff and our stay in Montreal was fabulous as a result. Please note that this was the Delta at 475 President Kennedy, not the other Delta in Montreal

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Service”
Reviews.Author: Beenthere2367
Reviews.Content: My stay at the Delta Montreal this past weekend was very very disappointing. First off, the carpets in both of my rooms (906-908) were disgusting and dirty, they had noticeable stains all over the them. I did not take off my shoes while in the rooms they were that disgusting and dirty. Also the shower heads had barley any water pressure and water came out almost like a dripping tap. The service at the Hotel was terrible, the front desk was rude and snobby when asking about anything. They lied to me about the cost of parking overnight by only telling me parking was $26. They did say that I could go in and out but forgot to tell me it was $26 per night and that parking in the city is free during weekends. So I was quite surprised when my parking bill was $63 and not the $30 I thought it would be. The hotel concierges knew absolutely nothing about the city when asked and they too were rude and snobby. I asked for directions numerous times and was either told the wrong way every time or told "oh it's about 20 minutes that way" with them pointing to a random direction. The map of city they had at they're desk did not even a compass on it and I'm not even sure why I kept asking for directions after the first 3 times they got us lost (it was mostly to see if they would ever send us in the right direction). They never once offered to print out directions, write them down or even lead us to a good place to eat only saying "St. Catherine's street has food". It seemed every time I asked about anything they told me to goto St. Catherine's Street which was about 2 blocks from the hotel. They never once said to check out Old Montreal or Mount Royal or actually anything when asked where there are good places to see and eat. I asked them to make restaurant reservations for 9 on Saturday and that too I had to end up doing myself after asking 3 times, without once being offered to take my name down so that they could try to do it when they get a chance. I seriously think they should all be re-trained because they have one of the most important jobs in the hotel and they knew nothing but to be snobby, unhelpful and annoying. I know I learned more about the city in 3 days then they probably know after spending they're whole life there. Overall it was a very bad experience since we did spend most of the time getting lost and looking ourselves for places to eat and site see. For spending $560 on two rooms for 2 nights and staying at the well known hotel chain, I will probably never stay at a Delta again, especially that one. All I can say that was positive is, if I didn't bring my own computer and there wasn't free wifi in the lobby, our trip would have been totally ruined by the staff and room conditions more-so then it already was.

Reviews.Title: “Well-located, but rooms are just adequate.”
Reviews.Author: zhenevieve
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at the Delta, the first being back in 2005. We got a deal on it off Priceline, which is why we stayed. The lobby and public areas of the Delta are really nice, and feel like the lobby and public areas of an upscale hotel. The staff was pleasant. The rooms leave something to be desired though. It was clean, but the furnishings and carpet felt old (and the carpet seemed stained and dingy). The bathroom is huge, but again, felt dated. One nice feature of the room is a balcony, however, the balcony wasn't clean, and was littered with old cigarette butts. The bed was fine. It wasn't particularly comfortable, but wasn't particularly uncomfortable. Parking is expensive ($26 for 24 hours), but does have a nice feature of unlimited entry and exit within those 24 hours. The hotel is excellently located in the middle of Montreal, and was especially well located for the Jazz Festival (our reason for being there). While it's not immediately next to a lot of good restaurants, it's a ten minute walk from Boulevard St. Laurent. And it's about a block from a Metro stop. I don't have any concrete complaints about the Delta, but I don't have any specific praise either. It was adequate. Worth the price we paid on Priceline ($85 for the night), but not worth more than that.

Reviews.Title: “This is the 2nd filthiest room I've ever stayed in...”
Reviews.Author: BabyButta
Reviews.Content: The Delta Montreal is all lobby...once you pass the lobby have your antennae up! Upon entering my room...there was hair all over the sink and floor in the bathroom. The smoke detector was dangling from the ceiling and the walls are so thin...you could hear the neighbors say "shhh...". On the balcony was a spider web was so large it took up 1/5 of the balcony. There was so much dust in this room...it dangled from the valence. The carpet is filthy and there was mildew on my pillow. The bathroom has less lighting than my NYC apartment's bathroom. The grout in the tub is tinted "chocolate brown"...clearly to cover up the dirt on the tile. That was the FIRST night! The next morning I woke up to find a FULL FACE OF MAKEUP inside the bed spread...nope, it didn't belong to me! And housekeeping has the nerve to come at 8:30am every morning... All in all, this is the worst room I've stayed in as an adult and I've traveled the world. The only room worse than this was a motel between Memphis and Jackson TN that cost $29.99 in 1988. Housekeeping is non-existent, in other words they knock but don't come in...the cleaning belongs to a bachelor pad. I looked at a pill bottle behind the night stand for 4 days that belonged to a past guest. I basically slept in this room that was provided by my employer while I worked at the Montreal Jazz Festival. Trust me, I'll never stay at this "motel" again....unless they tear it down and build something else on top of this lot.

Reviews.Title: “Delta gets a failing grade”
Reviews.Author: Flatfooter
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for a family weekend away. I booked this hotel using an "internet promotion" site, and have always purchased good quality rooms with excellent service - regardless of the discount received. I arrived at this hotel and I was "welcomed" by the Montreal's most uptight and snooty receptionist. She looked my name up and just handed me the keys. I asked what room I was in, if it was a king, and had a balcony. She told me "you booked online, you can't change anything - this is what you get for booking online". She did not advise me what the hotel had to offer, nor welcome me and wish me a pleasant stay. The room - despite having been advertised as "balcony" had none, and the air conditioning was 'turned off' leaving the room hot and stuffy. The carpet smelt of must and the general room had dings and dents all over the place, with outdated furniture, tv, and beds. I called for the air conditioning to be fixed and it took two hours to have the maintence guy come to "turn on a switch in a locked closet in my room". It was so hot in the room my infant was having trouble sleeping, which made for a very difficult evening. Finally when the air conditioning did work, it was too cold and the 'blanket' wasn't enough to keep me warm. The next morning the shower was broken and a 'dribble' was all I could get from the head so I had to 'splash' shower my way through a shower/bath. I would have called maintence, but I couldn't wait two hours for a shower, so I made do. The one bright point to the hotel was the Fitness Room attendent - He was bright, informative, and friendly and cared for us to enjoy the services. I would never recommend this hotel, ever - and wouldn't stay here again, even if there was a promotion for a free room. It almost ruined a family weekend trip. This hotel was so disappointing that I would even go so far as to never stay in another Delta again, and I have enjoyed other Delta's.

Reviews.Title: “A well run professional hotel.”
Reviews.Author: 31Taffman
Reviews.Content: After reading a few negative reviews before starting our journey from England, my wife and i certainly appreciated :- the rapid check in, the friendliness of the staff [typical feature of most Montrealians that we met], the room was first class and met all our needs. the quality of room cleaning was second to none. the restaurant service and quality of food was the best we have experienced in many a year. the concierge had all the answers to the information we requested. the location for the city centre and old town was ideal. This was our very first experience of Delta hotels and we thoroughly recommend this hotel. We place on record our grateful thanks to Marina and her team at the Delta. [lets hope the ottawa delta comes up to the same expectations!]

Reviews.Title: “The Heart of Montreal”
Reviews.Author: kiwiguy626
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Montreal Delta was simply wonderful. Upon our arrival, there were initially some reservation glitches. However, the hotel management and most especially, Catherine Dudoit from management, immediately remedied the problem. We have heard a number of things about Quebec and were not sure just how welcome we would be as we did not speak French. Despite this language barrier, virtually everyone we came into contact with from the front desk to the concierge spoke perfect English and were accommodating and gracious. Our room was beautiful and clearly well cleaned. We took advantage of the health club facilities, which were similar to a complete fitness center to include pool and racquet court. We also had the morning buffet breakfast, which was delicious and if you wanted, made to order. Everything you may have needed or wanted was right there in the hotel including a day spa, and even a barber. This place was almost too good to be true. We look forward to returning many times over the coming years to Montreal and most assuredly will be returning to the Delta. No slight to Holiday Inn, but this was no Holiday Inn. This was a 5 star hotel experience.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel needs to learn customer service”
Reviews.Author: Mindful_Travels
Reviews.Content: The only good thing about this hotel is the location. Being a Canadian I joined Delta Privilege loyalty program, thinking I wanted to support Canadian owned companies. Well that was the start of nothing at this hotel. When I walked up to the desk, I mentioned that I was a Delta Privilege member and the front desk clerk basically told me that means nothing. Put back in my place, I accepted it. She then informed me that i was in a room with two queens and i told her that there must have been a mistake on the reservation (not that she made a mistake) and that I had thought I had reserved a king bed. At first she told me that there was nothing available (without looking) I asked her to look once more and a miracle she found one. The other issue that I am also running into with Delta hotels is the lack of Wireless High Speed access. The excuse that two of the hotels are giving me now is that they are not able to change over to WIFI due to the number of government employees that stay at the hotel and their need for secure access. My partner works for a high tech company and they provide the internet security for accessing information and my friends that work for the Canadian government also have security measures for access. It really is because the hotel does not want to invest the monies into upgraded its systems. Once we checked into the room, the room itself was a shame. There was Mold on the window sills and under the wallpaper that was peeling away from the wall around the window. The lighting in the bathroom was burnt out and hummed. The toilet rolls was almost empty. There was a hole in the bathroom door the bathroom fan made loud noises. We stayed for two nights and none of these items were addressed as well as there was attitude from the front desk when i complained that there was no Hot water the first morning and when I commented that the bathroom toiletries had not been restocked after the first day. (they where never restocked during our stay). What surprises me is that the Delta makes it self out to be a first class hotel...

Reviews.Title: “Don't do it not even for a discount.”
Reviews.Author: giddyupOrlando
Reviews.Content: This hotel was horrible except for the lobby area and bar/restaurant areas looks. Even for a discount, the room was awful. Carpet was buckled and stained, literally had a rise in it about 2 inches tall especially where you walked. Patio had mildew and glass was broken. Disgusting. I will say bed and sheets were very nice as well as linens. For over $155 a night, go elsewhere. Michael, concierge was very good. Reservation was ready and correct. And yes I did complain. The response, "yes we know we are redoing all of ours rooms later this year? Well what the heck did care, I was there THEN.

Reviews.Title: “Not if I can help it”
Reviews.Author: Customer020
Reviews.Content: Terrible service for this over priced and poorly kept outdated hotel. I would never go back and due to the service at the front desk may not ever go to any Delta hotel. Because I did not book directly with the hotel they treated me like a second class citizen.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: Gracenugent
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Delta June 3-5. The staff at the front desk was always friendly and helpful. We requested an extra towel and a fresh warm towel was delivered within minutes and the cleaning staff was great too! Overall the service was excellent and was in a great location. I would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Spacious & Great Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: knugenx
Reviews.Content: We arrrived late to the city of Montreal - and check-in was speedy. Although the indoor parking was pricey ($26/day) - it was convenient - with unlimited in & outs. Some reviews complainted about the separate elevators for parking & access to the rooms (but I had no complaints - as they were somewhat adjacented to each other) - and the elevators (4) in general were speedy as well. The waiting area for the lobby was very nice - sofa and magazines available...there's a little convenient store for snacks (didn't buy stuff - but good to know there's one in case it was needed). Didn't use the fitness center or pool - but my toddler enjoyed the children play room (a small room with toys and stuff for kids). I was very impressed that hotel managment considered their little guest as well. The room (17 floor) was spacious and clean. Although the place was a little dated - the stuff in general was clean. The bathroom amentities were nice...and towels were clean and fresh. Beds were comfy - but too soft for my preference. I was a bit disappointed when I returned to room at 3pm that it wasn't cleaned yet - and AC wasn't working - but a call to front desk resolved both matters in 15 minutes. We had complimentary breakfast buffet - decent - but not worth the $17 price tag. While I found this throughout the city of Montreal - the staff in this hotel were very nice and helpful - with questions about the area.

Reviews.Title: “Best location”
Reviews.Author: goonybones
Reviews.Content: This hotel is an excellent location, right in the heart of the city. Rates are very reasonable, and the hotel itself is very clean and comfortable. The pool was lots of fun. The staff was very nice, up until the very end when they insisted on charging us for parking even though we didn't use their parking facilities.

Reviews.Title: “okay for what we payed...”
Reviews.Author: room733
Reviews.Content: i stayed at this hotel for 3 nights. we booked the room 2 months in advance, yet when we got there (at 4pm) the room was STILL not ready. we were on a non-smoking floor, but it still smelt stale and of cigarettes. there was also an odd lingering musty scent and our carpet was wrinkled up so you always tripped over it!! the balcony had no chairs, how can you enjoy your coffee out there in the morning sun? :( also, i was dissapointed in the lack of ice machine on our floor AND the fact that the soda machine was "out of order" and when i went to the little shop inside the lobby, they charged MUCH more for the same product!! on the other hand, room service was quick and beds were always made, concierge was helpful with directions, and the hotel is in a convienent location. i would not stay at the delta montreal again, for it was quite dated and smelly (for lack of a better word) - and i'm used to staying in hostels, so that saying something :P

Reviews.Title: “Never again!”
Reviews.Author: neuroriz
Reviews.Content: I took a risk on staying here despite other reviews and man did I regret it!! I will preface this review by saying that I like staying in nice hotels. This isn't one of them to the point that I didn't want to leave my bags on the floor and we checked out after the first night to move elsewhere. The rooms were old and dingy, the carpet was coming out and we found a hair on the bed that wasn't ours...I just didn't feel the room was clean or something. Pool area also leaves much to be desired. On the plus side, the room we had was actually quite spacious and the beds were actually really comfortable. the service was also good. Also got a good massage at the spa. If you are someone who doesn't mind a bare bones hotel with no frills about the room, you'll like it just fine here. But if you are a stickler for cleanliness and like hotel rooms on the nicer side, go elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Needed a king size bed but got treated like a king”
Reviews.Author: CanyonHawk
Reviews.Content: Our first trip to Montreal and a chance to visit with our Dutch friends whose son is attending McGill Univ. so we each agreed to try the Delta Montreal. Through the advertisement in the AAA guidebook we were told to ask for an upgrade. What we got from Delta's reservation service was called signature class and it turned out to be first class all the way. All our requests, king size bed (I'm 6'3") and a non-smoking room became what can only be described as an executive suite. The staff was always engaging and seemed interested in our comfort and the food was excellent in the hotel. We were offered the use of the signature lounge for cold (light) breakfast buffet and evening hors d'oeuvres. We went up one evening and never came down again. The location was walkable to McGill and the old city area was just a little further. My only little thing was having to pay for the car to be garaged while we were guests. My experience that it is usually not other Hotels practice for a honored guest to be charged for their vehicle but then this was my first time. I would go back and stay again for such a relaxing and pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Major renovations needed pronto”
Reviews.Author: musicmeg
Reviews.Content: We're really not sure how the delta can compete with the other fantastic hotels right next door. -obvious smoke smell in a non-smoking room (cigarette butts on the balcony) -worn and wrinkled carpets -chipped paint in sink -ancient and tiny TV almost 8 feet from the bed -$14 for internet!! -doors do not block hallway noise (18 year old kids partying until 3am) -Although the bed was quite large, the pillows were so massive that I slept without one -conveniently no comment card to fill out and we were not asked at check-out about our stay

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is very nice”
Reviews.Author: Cltek
Reviews.Content: Hotel is very nice and cute. Appreciate it. Would not mind coming back here again. Good location, lot of restaurants and places to see around the area. People seem friendly however not to much interaction with them so don't know really.

Reviews.Title: “nice people but exspected more”
Reviews.Author: nick0623
Reviews.Content: i found the hotel to be nice. i recently stayed at the delta for my honeymoon we told the staff it was our honeymoon when we booked and they told us they would see what they could do to make it special but when we got there we were given and average room and they told us that they could not do anything but give us some chocolate which we later found out was given to all the guests on my floor. its is very nice for and everyday trip but certainly was not a honeymoon setting even though my exsperience was not all that good i still think its a great hotel and would possibly go back

Reviews.Title: “signature room well worth it!”
Reviews.Author: famtimeOntario
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Delta Montreal on St Patrick's day and upgraded to a signature room. Well worth the extra few dollars. The hostess in the Signature Lounge was most gracious and welcoming. StÃ©phane in Le Cordial was most helpful with wine selection as well as local entertainment suggestions! It was our third stay at Delta Montreal and we will most definitely return on our next trip to Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “A Great City, A Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: kl32
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my trip to Montreal, and the hotel was great too. We found everyone very friendly and welcoming!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: Familytraveler46
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel to stay at, great location, very clean. I would recommend

Reviews.Title: “Needs a refresh - not up to Delta standards”
Reviews.Author: Beach_Loving_Canuck
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel numerous times over the past few months as it is the approved corporate hotel for our company. If I had any say, it certainly would not be a hotel that I would return to. On the positive side, the hotel is well situated in downtown Montreal and admittedly the room service menu and food quality is pretty good. Unfortunately, that's about all I like about this hotel. On my last stay, I was in a Club-level room on the top floor and even that room left much to be desired: - the bathtub enamel was chipped & patched in numerous spots - room temperature was hard to regulate, freezing cold while trying to fall asleep and then waking up in the middle of the night to a sauna - the internet connection wouldn't work in my room - TV is old & poor quality - carpets are old, ripped & stained ..............Not what you expect for a room that costs you almost $150/night! I am a Platinum level Delta Privilege member & this hotel simply does not live up to Delta standards! They've been saying for years that they are going to be doing renovations, I don't believe it anymore. Montreal has better hotels to offer than this for the same money.

Reviews.Title: “4 star hotel.. really?”
Reviews.Author: danvictory
Reviews.Content: When we first got into our room, it was freezing.. like 15 degrees.. it took about a day for the room to warm up completely. The carpet was ripped at door going into the bathroom. When taking a shower I noticed the tub wasn't very stable (moved side to side). We also had very noisy neighbours and when I called and complained, the front desk dealt with it but it didn't stop. It was an alright hotel room.. but definetely not 4 stars!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel; car stolen; terrible service”
Reviews.Author: Jcharron
Reviews.Content: While the hotel itself is quite nice we had a terrible experience with the Delta Hotel Montreal. Traveling with a hockey team, we brought the hotel a fair bit of income on an otherwise quiet weekend. Our car, all my son's goalie equipment, and the countless other little things one keeps in a car were stolen from the hotel's paid underground parking lot.
