The hotel's response was to offer a free breakfast while we waited for the police to arrive and refusal to provide any other compensation - not even a refund on the parking fees for the night our car was stolen. I was actually told at the hotel had no responsibility for the garage, which guests have to pay for, and were absolved of any liability because they have signs to that effect in the garage. So, don't drive to this hotel and certainly don't expect any support if your vehicle and personal possessions are stolen while in the hotel. One has to wonder what the hotel's policy is for other crimes that occur in the rooms and other facilities of the property.

Reviews.Title: “Tries, but does not always succeed”
Reviews.Author: keithoflondon
Reviews.Content: I had a standard room. Great rate. The hotel needs some renovations. The carpeting in my room was terrible and the furniture quite beaten up (1101). But the room was spotless. The bathroom was clean and large. The management was helpful when for two mornings I didn't have hot water; I received some compensation. Wake up calls were handled well; room service was great. The restaurants were well run. The pool and hot tub delightful. The spa lovely. I had a pedicure, but again the staff had trouble getting hot water. The location is excellent, close to McGill, shopping and near to the Montreal Museum of Fine Art. Taxis are found on rue President Kennedy. It is not a quiet hotel because it takes up a city block with two very busy streets. I heard a lot of sirens. Loved the fact I got the Globe and Mail every morning. Check in and check out was a breeze and the concierge was helpful. I would return, but again the hotel needs some updating.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean hotel with super friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: stevo_b27
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here during our trip for her LASIK surgery. I made reservations by telephone and it was very easy, the man I spoke with was helpful enough to find the corporate rate for me and detail each room type. Between the time I booked and the time we arrived I had many questions which the concierge Danny was more than happy to help with. Every morning we were greeted in the lobby by the concierge or other staff with a smile and questions of things we may need. Food: We only visited the restaurant for the breakfast buffet (20 dollars before tip). The selection was great and the quality was perfect, on top of the regular breakfast buffet you could step just outside the restaurant and have fresh waffles, omlets or egg of choice prepared right in fron of you. Rooms: I did find the room to be a bit smaller than I expected, but you are in Montreal and its just a place to sleep. The maid was by daily to clean the room, one day we walked in while she was cleaning and she was standing in the tub scrubbing the walls. Very clean rooms. The maid would leave chocolates on our bed each day. With the signature room you have access to the signature lounge where there is always coffee available through a Kurig machine, pop in the fridge, and other benefits daily. Location: This hotel is right downtown and about a 5 minute walk from St. Catherine street. 15-20 minute walk from the Bell Centre. Everthing you need in the way of shopping, bars and entertainment,and restaurants is in walking distance. Once again the staff is probable the friendliest I have ever encountered at a hotel, food that we did eat was great and it is in a prime location. I will be staying here for future visits to the greatest city in the world.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: excobra_driver
Reviews.Content: An excellent experience. Staff was friendly and courteous. Room decor is aging but impeccable. Close to soooo many things, especially life on St Catherines St. A great deal if you get one of the online specials.

Reviews.Title: “Good Room And Service”
Reviews.Author: choirgirlcalifornia
Reviews.Content: Our first time to Montreal. Our room was spacious and clean. The bed very comfortable. It was about 3 blocks to the train and shopping, and about a 10 minute cab drive to Old Town. We took a city tour and the bus picked us up at the hotel which was convenient. The staff was friendly and helpful. I found a huge discount on this hotel from the Montreal Tourism web site. They have season specials that included one night half off as well as breakfast which was excellent!

Reviews.Title: “Delighted with Delta”
Reviews.Author: Madeleine75
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here over the weekend. The staff were friendly and helpful. The room was very clean as was bathroom. We had a nice balcony with a great view. The bed was very comfortable. We also had the buffet breakfast which was very good. Great price too: we were really happy with this stay.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this property -- Very worn & tired, and rude staff”
Reviews.Author: JusWannaCleanRm
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel for two nights, and rented a meeting room for one day. The meeting room, and food service for my event were fine and at par with other name brand hotels, such as Marriott. The hotel room was a major disappointment, and is one of the worst hotel rooms I have seen for a "brand name hotel". While my room was large, the carpet was worn & stained, and the bathroom was dirty and in need of remodeling. Too much air freshener only made things worse. They are also doing some type of work on the building, as their was construction noise (grinding) for hours at a time.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Service!! Not Delta Standards.”
Reviews.Author: DawnLMM
Reviews.Content: - Stayed 3day long wknd of May. - Booked by an Ontario employee under family rate via internet. - Travelled with a friend who has food allergies, I emailed the reservations explaining that we request a fridge in the room for her 'special' food items. Received a reply email from reservations saying they put a request on my reservation. - Upon check-in I re-confirmed the fridge in the room, the woman said, yes it is there. - Visiting my BF who lives in Mtl, my married friends came for the wknd, I put the room in my name & added theirs to the reservation. I was staying with my BF in Pointe Claire. They UP'd my rate by $20.00 even tho I wasnt staying overnight & it was just 2 people in the room. I spoke to the might mgr about it, he said he would fit it, it was not fixed. - Room was horrible, probably the yuckest room in the hotel. But it was oversized. Stain in the comfortable, door in the room opened to a panel box of some sort. Bugs squished on the lamp shades. Side table was broken. Stains on the carpet. Awful poor room. AND NO FRIDGE IN THE ROOM. Called front desk (just after check-in) They said it would be up. Came back late that night still no fridge...called desk, they said 1st thing in the morning (sat). STILL DIDNT GET THE FRIDGE. We had to BUY a cooler from a store to put my friends 'special' food in with ice from the machine. - Went to desk on the sunday to just inform the mgr about the fridge. Asked for duty manager, after speaking to her/him they sent it to my room, THE NIGHT BEFORE WE LEFT!! We didnt need it anymore, WE BOUGHT A COOLER. Went to the pool, it was a 1/2 lap pool. All of a sudden a bus load of KIDS came into the pool, I didnt mind the noise, I was enjoying laps...but the kids didnt read the sign or the pool attendant didnt stop them from disruptting me from doing laps. Went to the bar for a drink sat night. Bar tender was more interested in taking pics & texting with his cell phone. He closed the bar an hour early due to no guests, however there were 8 couples, we all just arrived within 5min of each other. I complained on 'Delta Listens', a msg wrote me back & refunded me $75.00 for our troubles. It wasnt enough tho. We paid $60.00 for an extra person who wasnt sleeping in the hotel. $20+ for parking, didnt get a fridge, had to PURCHASE a cooler for my friends food, which we had to throw in the garbage. Id stay at Delta Centre-Ville next time in Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “good business hotel, bit boring but comfy!”
Reviews.Author: Ingka1971
Reviews.Content: While basically everything in Montreal is on walking distance, this hotel is not an exception. Though it's a bit off from the city center (like st cath. or the old port) it's still easy to walk down or use the fantastic bike plan which Montreal offered. The staff on the front desk is friendly and helpfull. Also having a concierge manning his own desk to handle all kinds of practical questions is a good service and makes checking in/out fast and painless. A hand written welcome with a little snack and a bottle of water makes all the difference if you just have been travelling for almost 18 hours. I appreciate these little things a lot. Rooms are very spacious (almost a bit too much) and quit standard furnished. A flair of smoke in the room, thought it was marked non smoking. However the bed was hugely comfy and I really enjoyed it. Little bonus was the balcony, even available for you to sit on the 20th floor. Parking is not cheap, but like any other Delta hotel they have this drive/in out arrangement, so you pay a fixed rate and you can take your car in and out any time. Approx 30 cad incl. tax I believe. Haven't been using the breakfast buffet, there's plenty of nice places around for less money .. but it's probably good. Montreal is a great city to spend a weekend ... don't hang around in the hotel too much, enjoy it's great restaurants and sights and when you get back ... there is very comfy bed waiting for you

Reviews.Title: “Could have been better”
Reviews.Author: tomj_canada
Reviews.Content: Booked a Premier room through hotels.ca at this property for one night. Although I had selected a non-smoking room, I was given a "smoking" one. Tried to argue with the staff, to no avail (You are second class customers when you book on third-party websites.) The room itself was clean and the beds were very comfortable. However, the showerhead was malfunctionning, water was warm at most, and the TV and lamps were quite old. There was also a tear on the fabric of the chair... Remember, this is a Premier room... I can understand why other reviewers mention dated room,as it is certainly the case in regular (a.k.a Delta) rooms. Parking is expensive for Montreal, at $26 a night. In short, except if you get a good price (under $120 a night) and are ready to tolerate a few annoyances, there are better similar hotels in town.

Reviews.Title: “rather sleep on the street than take a room at the delta”
Reviews.Author: boo2delta
Reviews.Content: ah montreal and the beautiful old port. It was nice when I stayed at the embassy suites last year. I can still remember the overwhelming feeling I had when I opened the door and walked around the room in ah of everything. They were booked this year! I asked my travel rewards for a hotel like embassy suites and they sent me to the delta..I was suspicious of the name..sounded kind of ONE star but I trusted the travel people.they said it was nice. Never book through travel rewards..do it yourself than call them...anyways I opened the door to the delta and nearly cried.....it was horrible like the bates motel. Everything was old style and looked like it came from value village. Shower was yuk...and the shampoo...I had few bad hair days especially in the humid weather. I smelt bad ..I guess the soap wasn't cleaning me...was it soap? The blow dryer smoked and stopped working. My friend ordered room service, I never do but...he doesn't get out much...and it was fifty dollars for 2 orders scrambled eggs and toast...I it sent back. Movies are 15.00 each which my FRIEND ordered without me knowing. I don't think the ritz charges these prices...I could not cancel because of expedia...made my trip frustrating but we still tried to make the best..and left one night early. There are other hotels that are better for the same price or a little more..but it's worth it...I'am hoping this reaches many people...BEWARE OF DELTA HOTEL!!Please...oh yea...the air conditioner was loud..and the parking was $26 a day...things keep coming to me..I probably forget other things...

Reviews.Title: “Not acceptable”
Reviews.Author: halesh
Reviews.Content: The rooms are outdated, small, dark specially the bathroom, filthy carpet, shredded towels..ugh! No Wifi in the rooms. Expensive parking. Staffs are not friendly either. they didn't change our room, and gave us S*** because we booked our hotel via Expedia and not directly from them. We moved out right the first morning. Stay somewhere else. You can find much better places with the same price.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location but a bit dated.”
Reviews.Author: nep67
Reviews.Content: This is a hotel is in excellent location. We stayed there while the Montreal Jazz Festival was on and it was only blocks away. Also only 2 blocks from the busy shopping street of St. Catherines. Our room was on the 18th floor and had a nice view. The staff was very friendly and helpful. We stayed in a Delta room which was very dated and in need of upgrades. Maybe the Signature rooms are a lot better value for the extra charge? We only stayed 2 nights and the hotel was sold out so didn't bother upgrading. I do have to say that the beds were VERY comfortable. Would probably only stay here again if we were to pay the extra for a Signature room.

Reviews.Title: “... meh ... there's a lot better out there”
Reviews.Author: kekbaldw
Reviews.Content: Not a great hotel. rooms are old and dated. Carpet in our room was raggedy and old, and the room smelled like smoke. We saw a number of spiders ... made us feel very uncomfortable. Our room had a giant locked door the the airconditioning unit in it ... which cycled on ever 30 mins or so ... very annoying at 2am. good location, but wouldn't stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Should Have Known Better”
Reviews.Author: OftenTravelling
Reviews.Content: Was obliged to stay at this hotel as it was one of the last hotels to have available rooms during a city-wide convention. After staying at the other Delta a year ago, and it was atrocious, I should have known better. The staff and service here isn't terrible, it's also not great, but it's the only redeeming quality in what can only be described as a high-rise motel. Apparently the place is being renovated. Good because the room I stayed in would embarrass the Bates Motel. Carpet had visible waves, box tv circa '76, bathroom lighting, well, it's hard to believe the local building code permits the dim levels. Wifi doesn't work in the lobby areas, though it's supposed to.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Home away from Home”
Reviews.Author: leo55NewDelhi_
Reviews.Content: The staff is friendly and welcoming. They help and like to make your stay comfortable. Rooms are fresh and comfortable. Location is ideal for a queit holiday

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, but nothing special”
Reviews.Author: tadak
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Delta Montreal during the last weekend of May. On the plus side, the hotel room (upper floor) was clean with comfortable beds and the location is very good (2 blocks from St. Catherine St and easy walking distance to the Plateau area and McGill, 1 block to the Metro station, a few blocks from the Provigo grocery store). Staff at the front desk were very good at giving out maps/directions and recommending restaurants. On the downside, the bathroom door did not lock, so my 2 year old son had a field day visiting us in the bathroom, the elevators were extremely slow, some of the staff were a little on the surly side and the underground parking was cramped, dirty and a little bit scary, despite being $20/night. Overall, not a bad stay, but not a very memorable one either.

Reviews.Title: “Hasn't been updated since the '70's”
Reviews.Author: mmuller2
Reviews.Content: This hotel was clean, but extremely ugly, worn down, and hasn't been updated since the '70's (seriously, brown decor and all). Carpets were vsisbly worn (stained, buckling and torn). Bathrooms were all formica and lucite. Really, I don't kid, not updated since the '70's. Also, no safes in the rooms. Stay at the Hilton Garden Inn or even the Holiday Inn next door, has to be an improvement.

Reviews.Title: “Delta has always impressed me”
Reviews.Author: traveller111111
Reviews.Content: I was quite satisfied by this hotel and had none of the difficulties reported in other reviews. I had a room on the â€œSignatureâ€� floor, which means free internet and a nice continental breakfast and cocktail lounge on the top floor. (The food is reasonable; the lounge/view is excellent.) Iâ€™ve gone for the Signature before and found it definitely worth an extra $20-30 or so. My room was a decent size and sort of â€œLâ€� shaped, meaning the beds and desk were a bit separated, which is nicer than the standard rectangle. Also a balcony, though it was rather plain. Furnishings were very nice but nothing special. I did not see the pool/fitness facilities but I noticed there was a childrenâ€™s playroom available at the entrance, which struck me as a sign of a well-organized and equipped facility. Somewhat oddly, the Signature rooms apparently all come with a small working fridge that is empty. Convenient for me since I buy/bring my own things, but the person beside me at checkout was quite irate that there were no mini-bar items for his convenience. I am consistently impressed by the Delta chain - this is the fourth Delta I can recall staying in (and the second I've reviewed in TripAdvisor), and I've always been happy. It is nicely mid-to upscale without extravagance or pretension.

Reviews.Title: “Not the worst ever, but close.”
Reviews.Author: avd123
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were disappointed with every aspect of our stay at this location. Our room was not only dated, but it bordered on decrepit. The other guests were noisy, the king sized bed was sagging in the middle, their were no blankets of any substance, the furnishings were well past it and oddly laid out. The list goes on. On our first night I phoned the desk at 11pm to complain about rowdy neighbours partying in the hallway. To his credit, the clerk offered to move us, but it was 11pm and we were in bed. It wold have been better to just get the rowdies out of the hall. After a lousy nights sleep (noisy neighbours and uncomfortable bed), I looked forward to a nice shower. Wrong place. The shower seemed to have a mind of its own and the water temperature changed from scalding to freezing without explanation. After I got out, the water kept running and between us we couldn't figure out how to make it stop. The only redeeming quality of the hotel was its location. Luckily, we have lots of other options for downtown facilities. When we left my wife and I agreed on one thing - never again at the Delta Montreal. I'd rather sleep on my deck in a snow storm.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time!”
Reviews.Author: YasHKinZ
Reviews.Content: Spent the Easter weekend visiting downtown and old Montreal and found a great deal online for $89/night so we booked three rooms at this hotel (I went with my husband and three single friends). We got great rooms on the 16th floor and the beds were the comfiest ever ( I love fluffy beds with pristine white linen!). The rooms were spacious, we had two rooms with king beds and a third room which had two double beds. This last room had a balcony of its own even. It is one of the better delta's i've stayed at. Comparable to a sheraton. The hotel was quite busy and the elevators are very slow.. something I heard a lot of people complain about. Morning staff were extremely helpful and friendly. I had free internet ( had i taken a laptop) in my room. Parking at the hotel is fairly expensive given rates at the other garages and the didgy condition of the Delta garage, but we paid the $26/night for the ease. Only real issue I had was that on our 1st night, one of my friends got locked out of their rooms and concierge had to call and wake me and my husband up. Because the rooms were under my name they wouldn't let my friend back into his room,despite me okaying it over the phone and providing them with his name as verification, after all the concierge did call my room directly. I had to go downstairs with a piece of ID and when I did, the guy didn't even look at my ID but stated that it was ok ( I suppose in his defense I did have a pretty mean look on my face and was not pleased about being woken up at 3 a.m. ..) On check out it came out that we didn't have hot water in the morning and the staff very kindly volunteered on their own accord to discount 40% off that night's rate, which was very nice of them as we weren't expecting that, especially because we had already paid for all three rooms. However she mentioned that she can easily fix the issue as they don't do their audits till midnight! As I write this review though, they only credited two rooms and the third room (ironically my room) - did not receive the discount, I plan to follow up with them. Hopefully they will refund the money back. All in all a great hotel to explore the city, especially because it was an easy walk to old montreal , downtown shopping and st catherines!

Reviews.Title: “Unimpressed”
Reviews.Author: 1josh777
Reviews.Content: Let me start off my saying that I booked my stay at the Delta Montreal through hotwire. I filled out all the information including that we are a family of 4 including 2 children. Having said that, when we arrived, which was late at night, at the hotel and went into the floor (3rd) the smell of cigarettes was overwhelming so I thought maybe the room will be an exception. Well, I was wrong. The room smelled so much like cigarettes... much more than the hallway. I was not expecting this because as I mentioned the information I provided to hotwire included that we were traveling with two kids. Two seconds after we got inside the room my son (10 years old) went to the bathroom and got locked in. The door would not open. We had to call maintenance but they did come right away and fixed the problem. Needless to say we had already decided we would ask for a room change however we waited for the next morning because the kids were too tired. The next day we asked to change rooms and were asked to come back after other people had checked out, which we did and were given another room without problems. The 2nd room was smoke free so we had no problems in that department. However, the showers were a mission. The hot water was not consistent and would go back to cold and then back to hot in an instant (this was also a problem in the 1st room). I did like the beds (they both had pillowtop mattresses and very comfy pillows and he rooms were seemingly clean (I write it that way because the first room had kit kats under the bed). No fridge or microwave in either room. On the second day my kids asked if we can go to the pool so we did. The pool smelled funny, and after our time there and our swimming clothes were dried they stunk very badly. I had to put them in a separate bag so I would not mix them with the other clothes. They need to do a better job in cleaning that pool. Also, there are not lifeguards. The things that I did like about the hotel were that is very closed to everything (at walking distance), had many services available right in the lobby (entreprise rental, taxi, spa, etc), and were very cordial. The lobby does look nice, if you can count that as a plus. Overall, I would not recommend the hotel based on my experience. The city was wonderful though.

Reviews.Title: “Not a great experience”
Reviews.Author: happycamper44
Reviews.Content: Public areas in hotel appeared to be clean, but room wasn't the cleanest and stale smoke smell permeated all our belongings and made it undesirable to spend any time in room. Noise could be heard from adjoining rooms.

Reviews.Title: “No Heat!”
Reviews.Author: Canuckinbklyn
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nts. Heat wasn't working in our room. Maintenance worker fixed it promptly but it shut off again at 1:00 A.M. After a struggle we were given a different room. Hot water was erratic all weekend; we were told it was a hotel-wide problem. Had to argue with the manager to get a credit for the night we spent without heat. Have stayed here many times in the past; this was the first really unpleasant experience.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable & good value”
Reviews.Author: Richtree7
Reviews.Content: Booked Feb 5th - 7th via Hotwire. $66 per night plus approx $30 in tax etc. Total=$167.00. Had a room on 18th floor with free internet. Had the breakfast buffet on Sat. morning..Excellent! Love the omelots to order and Belgian Waffles. Staff very helpful and always a cab near the front door...also an Enterprise Car Rental within the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: nafiz256
Reviews.Content: It's a late review but at least I got around to doing it. I booked the room through Priceline and arrived in Montreal on the planned date. I was greeted at the reception and then came the bad news. The lady at the reception told me that the only kind of bed available for the price I booked is a Murphy bed and that too is a double. I tried to haggle for a King Bed and eventually the lady suggested that I could upgrade to a King-bed room (I believe it's a deluxe room) on a private floor another $45/night which will also include free wine and cheese during the Happy Hour and free breakfast buffet every morning. For a total of $135/night and me being very picky about the bed I sleep in, I opted for this. The funny thing was I did not say anything about this trip being a special occasion. However, as I entered the room, I found rose petals sprinkled all the way from the door to the bed and chocolates on the pillows. Don't know if it was a nice gesture for the unexpected upgrade or I was just in the wrong room meant for somebody else. Another good thing about the room was the bathroom - one of the biggest I have seen in a hotel. All in all, the stay was quite pleasant, the free breakfast quite good and staff responded quite positively to any request I had.

Reviews.Title: “This is absolutely a keeper!”
Reviews.Author: ajdesor
Reviews.Content: I travel a lot for work and leisure and I find the Delta Montreal to be second to none. The rooms are large, the staff is so helpful, the temperature is easy to control and HVAC system is not noisy, beds are comfortable, the Delta Privilege program offers good value as well (Free Internet and local calls) and, at certain time of the year, the rates are very reasonable. As for the decor, I find it is contemporary and restful. The small balconies are nice. I have always found service to be excellent, be it the TV to repair, getting a meal through room service or any other. Get a room on the Signature floors where the breakfast and appetizers, included in the price of the rooms, are delicious. The rooms on these two upper floors are a bit smaller but are certainly still roomy, most of them are for two persons. You are a two minute walk to either the Place des Arts or McGill subway station from where you can access the Montreal Underground walkways and shopping. The only minor inconvenience is that there are not enough elevators, this is probably because this building was originally designed to be an appartment/condo tower. I highly recommend for both business and leisure - great family hotel with a nice pool. Also, good fitness club and handy business centre.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in general - Lacks of charm”
Reviews.Author: LavanderiaChina
Reviews.Content: Delta Montreal has good decent rooms if you upgraded to the executive ones. The other ones are smaller. The toilets are noisy. you can hear your toilet very loudly and your neighbors! The bar in the hotel is great! The breakfast buffet and options are good too.

Reviews.Title: “Best of the best”
Reviews.Author: VermontLinda
Reviews.Content: This was the best experience ever. We were upgraded to Signature status because of an e-mail I received. The club was closed until the second day we were there. We received free drink coupons as well as free breakfast coupons in another of the hotel restaurants. The room was huge and the staff was so friendly. I needed to have my glasses frame tightened. Someone came to my room within 5 minutes of my asking for help. Once the signature club room was opened we were treated like royalty. The food was plentiful and we ended up buying only 3 meals the whole time we were there.There is a little grocery store (depanneur) just around the corner for beer purchase adn a liquor store just across the street for wines purchases. Very handy!

Reviews.Title: “Nice family place”
Reviews.Author: SamuelChamplain
Reviews.Content: The room are very large for the price paid, and compared to other similar hotels at similar prices : a great value. The kids had a lot of room to play. We could have used a small fridge. The bathroom was also very roomy, with a large counter top. The staff was very friendly, polite and helpfull at all levels. We liked the indoor pool, and used it a lot ! Great location, right downtown. Very convenient. The hotel restaurant was way too expensive for our family budget.

Reviews.Title: “If you can avoid it, you probably should !!!”
Reviews.Author: AgarwalR
Reviews.Content: We booked in through hotwire, and hence were provided with a room surrounded by other tall buildings instead of the skyline/ mountains. On the first night, our toilet choked and it took 3 calls to the front desk and 1 hour to fix the issue. Finally we changed rooms. This room was stuffy. Difficult to breathe. The heater units are old and noisy. Location is pretty good. You have malls, cinemas, etc - all 5 mins walk. Parking is $25/ night. Overall the experience was just average.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Stay at the Delta”
Reviews.Author: ADKWoman
Reviews.Content: My husband, young son, and I stayed at the Delta Montreal for four nights in October. We actually selected the "Aroma Package" which offered room service breakfasts each morning and dinner in either their restaurant or bar each night. We did this because the price was excellent, and it made the trip easier to not have to think about breakfast and dinner when traveling with our little boy. We are really, really happy with our experience there. The common spaces are beautiful, festive and upscale. Our room was great as well. I was worried since there were some reviews commenting on the lack of cleanliness and the hotel's real need to update. (They do begin renovations in January 2010.) Since we were there for four nights, I think we had a good opportunity to find things to complain about, and we haven't one! The room was immaculate, decorated in a neutral, elegant way, the pool facility was great for laps and playing with our son, the breakfasts were perfect (fresh croissants and great coffee!), and dinners were surprisingly good. The staff was first class - never snooty but highly efficient and helpful - and the Delta really means it when they say they are kid friendly. We did not see any families other than ours, but everyone on staff said a cheerful bonjour to our son, wanted to make sure he knew there was a small playroom at the hotel, and he ate free the whole time. So, though we do tend to find faults with places we stay, we really haven't a single complaint about the Delta Montreal Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away”
Reviews.Author: spinnable
Reviews.Content: I've been here 10 minutes and I'm already regretting it. $25 parking, $14 internet and hotel needs an update through and through. I complained to the manager (Caroline) and asked for just one day of internet for free (of a two day stay) and she flatly refused. When you get customer service like that - not even offering a damn thing to make my experience better - you don't get repeat customers. Stay away.

Reviews.Title: “Bait and switch Hotel”
Reviews.Author: vickersboston
Reviews.Content: I booked a non-smoking room thru priceline. When I arrived I was given a smoking room despite my 2 calls to confirming the room prior to arrival. I was told that was only room available. Room reaked of smoke. Carpet had 2 large stains and was ripped in several places. I was shocked to see the 3 star rating still! I was told they might change the room the next day. The manager refused a switch saying " that is was happens when you go thru priceline. You learned a good lesson" besides she said all the rooms were sold out. I called the reservations in front of her and gave her a non-smoking room reservation I had just secured for an early check -in. Suddenly a cancellation "occured" and she assigned me a new non-smoking room. I would say the customer service was aweful. If they only want to offer smoking rooms to priceline they should say so. They were aweful especially because they did not care the my three year could not breath. They wanted to teach me lession. I heard that from at least 3 different front-desk attendant/ manager.

Reviews.Title: “Very satisfied, good location and reasonably priced”
Reviews.Author: NJ_Thomas
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Delta on Rue Pres Kennedy for a weekend in late August when we brought our son to McGill. The hotel is conveniently situated for anyone wanting to be close to the McGill campus. We got a rate of CDN$125 so I thought it was a pretty good value (hotel taxes added another $25). I would agree with other reviewers that the rooms are in need of some updates but I really couldn't complain about ours. It was large and on a high floor with a nice view, the bed was fine, and it was clean. We didn't use any of the hotel food service facilities or fitness center so I can't comment on them. Front desk staff were very pleasant and helpful. Overall I was quite satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “DISGUSTING”
Reviews.Author: devonle
Reviews.Content: I travel quite frequently, but still consider myself to be quite tolerant of most things. For instance, I would never go to the tropics and complain about bugs in my room, and I can overlook a hair that got left in the shower, no problem. However, I must say that the DELTA is at best a two star! The lobby and conference rooms are refurbished and quite nice - but the show stops there. The rooms are disgusting. I was in a non-smoking room, that smelled like an ashtray and had over 20 ciggarette burns in the carpet. Not to mention the room was terribly outdated, the fixures in the bathroom were chipped and scuzzy, there was no fan in the bathroom, even though there was a cover where the fan should be that was fallling out of the ceiling and covered with dustt, fabric pills on the sheets and blankets- add all of those things up, and it equates to a very poor experience. It was dirty, smelly, and just disgusting. There are great hotels in Montreal - this is not one of them.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: LUVSASKATCHEWAN
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in need of some updating, but had a great deal off hotels.ca. The staff were very pleasant and provided great suggestions for dinner and were very helpful in booking our activities. The hotel had easy access to the metro and St Catherines street. The walk to the old city was a little longer but still very doable. The rooms were very large. A huge buffet breakfast every morning.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible”
Reviews.Author: sjkel
Reviews.Content: I'm not a picky traveler. Most of my reviews I would say are upbeat and I always look for the positive, but I can't help but rate this hotel poorly. We booked it for a good price on hotwire, which I picked because they rated it a 3.5 star and it had a pool. The pool is a necessity because its always the highlight for our kids. That and watching movies before going to bed. Here's the rundown of what happened: The first night: We arrived late- about 8pm and the "ONLY" room left for me, my mom and my daughter in this huge hotel was a smoking room with a king size bed. We are not smokers and my daughter was gagging the whole time. So we went to the pool. The pool looked much bigger online, but at least it was indoors. After getting into it however, it seemed very dirty. Again, I can put up with a lot, but there was dirt all around the edges, the water seemed cloudy and in spots the bottom of the pool seemed slippery. And there was mildew all on the ceiling. So we went back to the room hoping to see a movie and after an hour trying to work the tv and calling down to the desk, they could not get it to work. By the way, the tv was one of those old boxy kinds and not very big. The second night: We requested to be moved, so somehow by 9am we got a non smoking room and two full sized beds that was clean and ready to be moved into. (Were they really full the night before or was it because we were discount guests they didn't want to be hospitable?) When we tried to rent a movie that night, the same thing happened. The person at the desk could not get it to work even after checking to make sure everything was activated. The janitor was even sent up to the room to check it. It was kind of insulting- we are seasoned travelers who know how to rent movies! It never worked, so the front desk person said when we leave the room in the morning to tell the front desk and they will get a repair person to go up and fix it while we are out. Third day: So in the morning we did that. Finally we got a competent person who looked in back and found that the switch had never been activated! That evening we finally got to watch our movie on the old tv. Another aspect about this room: the sheets on the mattress are not fitted (which I don't think is unusual for beds in hotels) however, the sheet wasn't even pulled down over the mattress- it was like a previous review said- like the bed was short sheeted! So we remade the bed, not well enough I guess though, because in the morning the sheet had slipped off and we were sleeping on the bare mattress! Gross! The last morning: I went to see what kind of compensation we could get for the mattress experience, the smoky room and the tv problems and they kindly waived all my parking fees for 3 days. And of course we weren't charged for the movie. It was fine. I don't like complaining, but this was a crazy bad experience. Also, the concierge was only adequate. Not friendly at all, but gave the basic information we asked for. The hotel from the lobby looks like a 3.5 or 4 star, but the hallways and rooms look like a 2 star. Worse than any cheap hotel we've stayed at. The rooms were dated- formica counters in the bathrooms. One bathroom light over the sink- making a very dark toilet and shower area. No fridge in the room. Badly stained carpets and a thick layer of dust around the corners of the room where the carpet meets the walls. Now that my kids are getting to be teens, our values have switched in hotels to needing decent pools and movie service. We won't be staying here anymore. But I imagine someone looking for a deal could make this hotel work if they tuck in their sheets real well and overlook the mold and dust. The only good things were the location- right downtown- and the bar. We had dinner in the bar that first night and it was amazing. The food was delicious and beautifully presented. Better than most restaurants we went to those 3 days.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, clean, great location, quality weight room”
Reviews.Author: saltsunandtime
Reviews.Content: Travel zoo $99/night. I'd pay $150/night for this one. King size bed had plush linen and pillows. Clean bathroom with strong water pressure. Large well-maintained weight room with all the amenities of a good private gym. Parking was expsensive at over $20/day. Friendly bilingual staff. This location is perfect for access to McGill, St. Laurent, St. Denis, east end Montreal, old Port, etc...

Reviews.Title: “Always a good stay, one of MTL's best values!”
Reviews.Author: swlogan
Reviews.Content: On average, my partner and I (or with a group of friends) treat ourselves to a weekend in Montreal once every two months. Amongst the numerous hotels we've stayed at, I have to say, the Delta continues to be one of the best choices when it comes to satisfaction, as well as for price! I'd say that you REALLY DO get the 3/4 star hotel, at often TWO star prices. For the best rate, book with CAA, and often you can change it for the "last minute rate". ROOMS: I've had the chance to stay in all 3 categories of rooms throughout different stays. While the pictures of the Delta rooms don't look all too appealing, the room have recently been renovated throughout the ENTIRE hotel, so the Delta rooms and the Premiere rooms look EXACTLY the same! The only difference is that the Premiere rooms are on high floors (who cares!) All rooms have nice duvets and SUPER comfortable beds! The Signature Club rooms have some nice added touches, such as iPod dock/speakers and LCDs. All 3 categories of rooms are LARGE, much more so than many other Montreal hotels. The bathrooms are your standard hotel bathrooms. The few minor issues I've ever had here have been solved ON THE SPOT, thanks to great staff. They have also ALWAYS been able to give us any requested extras (iPod speakers, CD player, Fridge, etc...) It's in a part of MTL that's a short walk from shopping/nightlife, or a cheap cab ride back after a drunken night out!

Reviews.Title: “Outdated hotel, not worth the price”
Reviews.Author: Unknown072
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from this hotel today. I am seriously disappointed in the facilities and rooms in this hotel. I was looking forward to enjoying the pool and kid's room. The pool water is very, very dirty, it seriously needs to be changed, it is comparable to slime. The changerooms are old and not very clean too. The kid's playplace is a closet. As for the rooms, the beds and linens are very comfortable and clean. Unfortunately that was the only clean part of our room. The shower had mold in the grout which was re-grouted in some areas, the bathroom is comparable to a 3star I stayed in Cuba. Yes, not very nice, but in working condition. I found a dirty pair of socks under my bed, (not ours). The balcony looks dangerous to say the least. TV's are old tube ones, (aren't flat screens affordable now?) The staff was friendly and the breakfast was great. Warning to Montreal visitors: there is a lot of crime in the city. We had our car window smashed and contents robbed, after paying $10 for parking, while taking a walk in old Montreal. The police said is was common. Note: we were the only non-Quebec plates in the lot and the only ones with a smashed window.

Reviews.Title: “Very good but loud heater”
Reviews.Author: LastSecTraveller
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a bit old but very clean and well managed. It is centrally located so it is easy to get to the Metro, shopping and university. The underground parking was clean and bright. The only thing was that the heater was too loud whenever it kicked in, we were woken up, so we turned the heat down just before we go to sleep... Overall the hotel is great, I would stay there again if when I visit Montreal in the summer.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel at a Good Price”
Reviews.Author: largeturkey
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very centrally located. All the attractions are within a 15-20 minute walk or less. If walking is not your thing, the metro is 2 blocks away. The staff was extremely helpful in suggesting places to eat and things to do. The indoor pool and hot tub are a plus, for after a long day of walking its nice to jump in the water. The room was spacious, although the tv could have been larger (but who goes on vacation to watch TV?) Free internet in the rooms, but you have to plug in your computer as it is not wireless. If you are going to montreal and want to be in a good location at a good hotel, this is the place to be. I recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “they p...s me ..[-] with money and when I asked why the manager told me thats the best team”
Reviews.Author: undrcontrol
Reviews.Content: never trust this hotel never use ur creadit card or ur visa staff not even smily parking is lik hell airless not safty at all i hold my horn to get help no way noone even care, i had to stip out my car to get help froem loppy ROOMS ...LOL JUST LOOK AT THE WINDOWS AND U CAN SEE HOW MENY SPIDERS THEIR,+ if u nee dhelp 2night such as movies .. u will have to call reception to got the moive what u want but dont try case i traied few tims noone even care.... the thing which is really heart me when i got my bills and i thought that thirs is charge misteak on it i have been to talke with them and the manger came did nothing but to till me about here great team whos never made misteaks at all so i was the bad guy then becuse i wanted just understand somthing i sewar they made my 1st vist to montreal like helllllllll ill never back to this city becuse of em Ill give them (-1 out of 10)

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Clean and Free Internet”
Reviews.Author: aaronn
Reviews.Content: - My second time staying at this Delta Location.... Here are my thoughts (i've been travelling for years and have spent a lot of time in hotels) Pros - Location - st catherine street is very close (all the shops, nightlife); walking distance from train station if you have a small bag; place des arts metro is 2 min away - Free Internet is key for me and I think a lot of travellers .... thumbs up for that - Accesible Gym with more equipment than 90% of the hotels out there... + there is a pool ...although the gym equipment is dated...you can still have a decent workout ... - Rooms are large and clean.... - Beds are very comfortable...in fact..i would put these beds up against the Marriott beds - very nice to sleep on Cons - the hotel is dated... 20 years ago it would have been in style but now it's starting to show its age (faded carpet, tube tv's, door handles on stairwell doors are falling off - elevators are slow..there are 3 elevators but you still end up waiting longer than you should have to for an elevator (and normally they are full) The above cons for me are not that big so I would stay here again if i get a good rate

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located, but far from the nightlife”
Reviews.Author: stigs17
Reviews.Content: Stayed three nights for NHL All-Star weekend this past January. Pros: Very good value for under $100 in the off-season. Clean, spacious rooms, good soundproofing of walls. Super-comfortable beds & pillows (both soft & hard). Pleasant & efficient staff. One block from Metro subway (either Place-des-Arts or McGill stops). On the doorstep of the impressive Eaton Centre shopping complex. Six blocks from VIA central train station. Huge liquor store one block south, though limited hours (noon-6pm). Cons: Soundproofing of door to hallway is non-existent. Expect to hear every door slam and drunken conversation in the hall thanks to extensive gaps around each door, thus bring earplugs. $26/night for underground parking. Pool area closes at 9pm, even on weekends. TV has ~25 channels, with only a handful in English. Tip: While centrally located, the area becomes a ghost town at night in the winter, even on weekends. Need to walk 12 blocks west to hit the nightlife & fine dining or 10 blocks south for Old Montreal. Any businesses/restaurants near the hotel shut down by 10pm. Overall, an enjoyable experience.

Reviews.Title: “People make a hotel!”
Reviews.Author: nlcouple
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Delta Montreal from August 5-9, 2009. It was an excellent experience. Our room was large, clean and had a balcony. However, it's the staff at this hotel that sets it apart. The front desk people bent over backwards to make sure our stay was a pleasant one. House-keeping people anticipated needs and asked if there was anything we did need? Manon at the bar was a sweetheart and was very helpful with recommendations for our excursions. The concierge was always there and very knowledgeable & helpful. I know, it may sound like we have a share in this hotel! However, when you get adequate service these days, it a relief. When fantastic service comes along. you need to tell people.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel around downtown”
Reviews.Author: petersdrivein
Reviews.Content: We stayed the last weekend in July on short notice, so we must have got a deal given the recession or something. $130 for a signature room with free breakfast, appetizers in the evening & internet was a great deal. Excellent service & the room was immaculate, but I think 4 days in a signature room is too much as we didn't have room in our stomaches for a nice dinner out on the town. The view was nice from the lounge on the 23rd floor, but $11 a drink is a bit much. They did switch up the snack buffet a bit from day-to-day Wearflip-flops by the pool if you can as the floor is slippery. It's nice down there though

Reviews.Title: “Clean/Comfortable/Affordable - FULL 4* Star+ Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jvalente_ca
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel this last Saturday August 1st and everything was what I expected from a 4 star hotel - the real bonus was the price $106+tx! The room had 2 double beds(clean & comfortable), a big bathroom(very clean) with a curved shower rod + a balcony with a GREAT view of the city. Not sure what previous poster was stating about this hotel being under renovations - it is NOT - call them directly if you are in doubt. Yes the cost of parking is well over $20 if you park there - but you can also park right across the street indoors for $13. Please note there are TWO Delta hotels located in downtown Montreal, the one we stayed at is located on President-Kennedy. At this price I will be staying at this hotel whenever I need a room downtown Montreal. J

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing Accomodations and Misleading Information!”
Reviews.Author: JVipond
Reviews.Content: My friend and I, along with our partners chose the Delta Montreal hotel from a Travelzoo special after a long and extensive search for a nice place at a reasonable rate. We were there to participate in the Montreal Dragon Boat Festival. We chose this hotel because Montreal Tourism rated it as a 5 star hotel. We were excited to get a good deal and to stay in a beautiful place. Service was good overall. Staff were helpful and resourceful. Room was very disappointing though. It was a small corner room (our booking said it was to be an oversized hotel room!). As well, it was very dirty, stained and torn up. Rugs were heavily stained throughout the room, closet doors and walls were dirty and evidently not routinely cleaned (water stains, dirt smears, etc.) and the carpet was ripped, torn and loose entering the bathroom area. It was so bad that the carpet was unravelling and numerous nail ends were exposed. I ended up stepping on these and having my heel bleed from it. There were a lot of extra expenses as well. Parking was around $24 a day and even a bar fridge available in your room was $20 a day. We ended up talking to the Manager about our experience and disappoinment where he was shocked to hear that the hotel was rated as a 5 star. He said that it was only a 3 star! He also mentioned that the hotel was going to be remodelled which was why the carpets and walls were in bad shape and left this way. We ended up getting one night comped because of our complaints (which we used digital photos of the room to show him the extent of the issues!). It was in a good location however, and we were able to walk to a lot of entertainment districts. Overall, would not go back this hotel location though. Found Montreal in general to be very expensive and the atmosphere a little rude.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and great staff.”
Reviews.Author: BSO2
Reviews.Content: This hotel provided myself and my friends with a great place to stay. It is a bit pricey even with a corporate discount you are still looking at a good chunk of change with parking. But I have to say the view and the friendly service made the stay worthwhile. The rooms are clean and housekeeping is swift and efficient. I would recommend this hotel to any traveller who is on business. I dont know If I would recommend this hotel to someone who wants to experience montreal nightlife as you have to take a cab from this location and there are closer less expensive hotels located in walking distance to the montreal nightlife scene.

Reviews.Title: “Great but could use some improvement”
Reviews.Author: habs1998
Reviews.Content: I stay at the Delta Montreal on June 25th-30th 2009 and it was great but it could use some improvement. When we arrived and went to check in to our Famliy suite the man said we booked it for tomorrow sowe couldn't go in. It was odd because when we booked it on the phone they said it was ready for June 25th. So we had to book a roon for one night then we could check in on June 26. We checked into that room and when we got in there was a big big washroom,a balcony but no mini fridge. We had to use a a big bowl with ice in it. The next day June 26 we went down to the Restaurant and ate the breakfast buffet it cost $18.50. Then we went to check in to the Family suite well it was amazing. One big kitchen with a full size fridge,a living room,balcony,two LCD TV's,a washroom and a bedroom. Overall the hotel was great but the front staff could use some improvement. Note: Balcony has some bugs.

Reviews.Title: “I would stay at Delta Montreal again!”
Reviews.Author: scrapedknees
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at Delta Montreal for 3nights,I was there for a Chief's Assembly for Quebec and Labrador.The staff were very friendly an helpful.My room was large and clean.I appreciated the weather report left on my bed an the fact that it was addressed to me personally .This made me feel very welcome.Unfortunately,I was unaware that this hotel offered rooms for smokers,I had to elevate to the main floor to smoke.That I didn't like.When I did learn that you offered rooms for smokers ,it was too late because they were all booked.I was surprised that the signature lub rooms didn't have balconies an regular rooms did.I personally think that, the signature club rooms should have a balcony.Overall, I enjoyed my stay.and would stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Dated and Tired”
Reviews.Author: UncleLed
Reviews.Content: This might have been a very nice hotel at one point but the rooms are not there anymore. My room was huge but the layout was poor. The toilet directly faced a huge mirror. which is not the most desired arrangement. In the main part of the room there were two lumpy double beds, an ugly concrete balcony, a ancient television and a stained-brown coffee machine. The rug had seen much better days and was stained and rippled. The room had miles of wall space but only one picture was hung and that was on a side wall. It was inhospitable and felt dated and unwelcoming. No wifi (free or otherwise) was available either; not great for a business traveler. My colleague reported that her bed was short-sheeted. On the plus side, the lobby was pleasant and the staff were very friendly but I can't recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location ...3 1/2 stars”
Reviews.Author: NYCchica
Reviews.Content: Delta Montreal is a huge hotel with all types of guests(families, animal lovers, couples, business, groups of young people, etc). After reading trip advisor reviews, we opt to stay in the signature room(most expensive) and glad we did. We went through expedia and got 30% off since we booked for 3 nights. The rooms are in the top floors, most modern w bedding and furnishing, free internet, and access to club room for computer use(old but does the job), magazines, free continental breakfast and evening snacks(alcohol pay extra which is fine BUT something not told until after you start drinking and many people were quite surprised about it and should be told up front). The food was good and perfect. The front desk are very nice. We asked for a corner room since many reviews suggested it for noise control and got it. Plus my daughter received a welcome gift which is always appreciated. The room was very comfortable and location is great!!! Short walks to shops, latin district. metro, and McGill. Plus parking is right below and u can exit as often as u like. The kid's activity room was nice but needs to be updated with books, games, and puzzles considering many pieces were missing and pages ripped. The down fall, the noise from the hallway is bad. even with the corner room the noise level you can hear like the elevator, people talking, and opening and closing of doors. I was surpised by this. Since there is over 400 rooms in the hotel, this won't be fixed anytime soon.. And yes, I agree w other reviewers if you have a party going on next door or even on the floor you might not get too much sleep. We were lucky and had no problems during the night.

Reviews.Title: “A Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: mmurarka
Reviews.Content: The place was nice. Rooms were very good and Hotel staff was very helpful. I used the business center also. There was a charge for parking but I had anticipated that.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean hotel.”
Reviews.Author: sierratango1
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for one night on my way to Quebec City, with friends. The hotel is in a good location. The rooms were a good size and very clean, with modern decor. The staff were very helpful and informative. They switched between English and French effortlessly, and were helpful to individuals that spoken either/both languages. They do charge additional (per day) for parking. However, we were able to enter/exit the garage throughout the day without any additional charges. They also charge extra for internet access. However, these aren't deal breakers by any means. After all, I doubt that one can find free parking around Downtown Montreal (for hotels, that is). In addition, I have found that many mid-range hotels charge for internet (which is unfortunate). Overall, I would recommend this hotel to anyone that can find a "deal" on the price. I don't think I would pay regular prices.

Reviews.Title: “Quite Deceiving...”
Reviews.Author: sens1992
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for one night and tought that this Delta is a very average hotel. The room was pretty big but the king size bed we had was pretty old and the mattress had waves in it so you could see where people usually sleep... Not too good for Delta... Went down to the pool (frigid water) and the hot tub was out of service. I have to say that the breakfast ordered thru room service was good and the lady who brought it up was very friendly. This is a hotel I would skip next time, it felt like it was a bit outdated.

Reviews.Title: “Overrated hotel, disappointed traveler”
Reviews.Author: Globalista
Reviews.Content: The hotel looks good from the outside and the lobbies and halls, but it is a ripoff and is behind the times in terms of amenities. Very annoying. While most hotels are giving away the Internet, the Delta Montreal charges $13.95 per day for the privilege of plugging in your computer to the world. They also charge you $1.60 per local phone call, which is bad enough but what's worse is they don't tell you that anywhere on the phone. You find out about it in a vague asterisk in the hotel room book. For the class of hotel they lead you to believe it is, there should be a minibar (especially since room service ends at 11 p.m.!) and an in-room safe.

Reviews.Title: “Not so good !”
Reviews.Author: cruiseking79
Reviews.Content: I had stayed at this hotel a few years ago and from what I remember, I was a nice hotel. Well ... it isn't anymore. This is definetly not what Delta Hotels are all about. This hotel is in a desperate need of a major renovations! From the leaking ice machine in the hallway to bed sheets that don't even fit on their beds. Wouldn't recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with great service”
Reviews.Author: curlygirl123
Reviews.Content: Location Walking distance to Metro, St. Catherine St. shops, Bell Centre (10-15 min.) and restaurants. Short cab to bus and train stations. Rooms Very large, clean room with balcony and windows that open. Rooms without balconies are smaller. Most comfortable hotel beds and pillows I have ever had! Nice furnishings and bedding. Large bathroom although the old shower needed updating. The shower pressure was very low unless on cold. No big deal though. Some rooms are more updated than others. Staff Very friendly staff and quick to accommodate your requests. Our balcony and windows were bolted shut for childrenâ€™s safety but they opened them for us. Building Very nice lobby. Pool but we didn't use it. I would definitely recommend this hotel and will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay in large room for excellent price”
Reviews.Author: Queenslander29
Reviews.Content: Hotel Delta Montreal is nicely situated between lively St.Catherine street and the hill Mont Royal. Quiet area of this large city, we almost reached every site of Montreal on foot. We stayed for 6 nights in a Premier Room, which was on 14th floor. It was very spacy. Very comfortable double beds. But the carpet is old and need to be replaced. But I definatly would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting. Booked through Priceline. Avoid, avoid, avoid!!”
Reviews.Author: aero_world
Reviews.Content: I booked this place on Priceline thinking it would be a great deal. But they gave me a room that heavily reeked of cigarette smoke on the second floor facing a busy street. Although the room was big, it was sparsely furnished and the lighting was very bad so it felt like an empty but smoky prison cell. Internet also cost extra. The three days I stayed there couldn't have gone by fast enough.

Reviews.Title: “Booked through Priceline - Did not meet 3 stars - Filthy”
Reviews.Author: CapCityCapitals
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Delta Montreal; 475 President Kennedy Avenue, Montreal, Quebec H3A 1J7; October 23, 2008 through Oct 26, 2008. I booked the room through Priceline, bidding for a 3 star hotel or better for 75 USD a night plus taxes and service fees. The hotel would have been up to the 3 star rating, had it been clean and in good repair. Unfortunately neither were true. I have included pictures in my review of the terrible conditions in the common areas. *There was a hole in the ceiling above the ice machine. *The elevator lobby from the parking garage to the main floor was filthy the entire stay. There was a piece of pizza in the ash tray next to the up button and trash on the floor. *My room wasn't very clean either. Note that the Priceline rate only got me a smoking room. I was informed at check in that I could pay extra to get a non-smoking room, but none were available any of the nights during my stay. I apologize for posting this 3 1/2 months after my stay. I hope that the hotel has improved over the last few months, but based on my experience I would not recommend staying in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Typical City Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jenny005
Reviews.Content: This is a typical City hotel. It looks like a concrete tower block from the outside - but that's because it is!! Mind you - when you're watching where you're walking because of the heavy snow you don't tend to notice!! The rooms were clean - although the bathrooms could do with updating. Fresh towels were supplied every day - and the maid came in to make up the beds too. No kettle - just a coffee percolator - which is fine, provided you like coffee tasting tea. We had the surprise of complimentary continental breakfast included in our stay - but for CAN$4 we could upgrade to hot food as well which was amazing. Eggs, bacon, sausages, French toast or pancakes, freshly made waffles or omelettes made to your choice of ingredients. The hotel is centrally located for all the underground shopping malls and it is very easy to find your way around. Staff in the hotel are very friendly and approachable.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay :)”
Reviews.Author: damirandveronica
Reviews.Content: Good hotel with a fantastic bed, one of the most comfortable I have ever stayed in. Very spacious, we had an outdoor terrace which was sealed shut, so we were a bit disappointed, but it was the middle of winter, so maybe it's understandable. We checked out the hotel restaurant on the first day, but was fairly pricey, so we ate out every day. Overall no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Stay!”
Reviews.Author: tbasta
Reviews.Content: We stayed there, me and my wife, from Dec. 25th, 08 to Dec. 28th, 08, and we had a room upgrade but guess what I am really wondering how the standard room are because ours were horrible. We chnaged the room four times because there is always something wrong with the room, no lights in the bathroom, very noisy heat system to the point you really can't sleep. The Service desk is very poor and unprofessional, they really need to learn about customer service and specially the managers there. I travel regularly and stay in hotels often in business, but this one was my worst stay ever, and i was very surprised because it's the Delta.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but go elsewhere for meals”
Reviews.Author: Rose27St_John_s
Reviews.Content: Room was great...large, clean, comfortable beds, coffee machine etc. No fridge in room. Nowhere to keep any drinks cold. No ice machine visible on floor. Dining ...breakfast EXPENSIVE. Most expensive I've seen as this is usually the best deal for meals.Maybe OK if you have an expense acct but $3.55 for coffee is up there.Same for juice. $13.00 for continental. Dinner selections seemed pricey also. No small portions. Maybe we should have shared one order...

Reviews.Title: “Really nice hotel, in a great location downtown”
Reviews.Author: Anthony06
Reviews.Content: I spent five nights here and found it to be an excellent hotel. Check in was very straightforward, very welcoming. Standard room was very big with king size bed, nice desk and chair, armchair - also a balcony. Bathroom was also a very good size. Very clean and had everything one would want. Free wifi as well which worked exellently. I only ate in the hotel once and that was for dinner in the bar on my first night there due to a late arrival. This was very nice too. Would definintely look at staying here again

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: tiger252
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights at the Delta Hotel and found it to be a well run hotel. The check-in lady was very friendly and when we asked if we could have a later check-out she was prompt to oblige. The standard room was very bright and well furnished. We had a big bathroom well equiped with the more than usual soap shower cap etc. The room was equipped with a internet cable which was free as well as in the reception area there were 3 free internet computers but very much on demand from the guests. The concierge was most helpfull with street maps and suggestions and sight seeing trips etc. The breakfast which was included in our Hotel price was very good with a big choice and friendy staff . All in all we did have a enjoable stay at the hotel and felt very comfortable We would stay again at the hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great night!”
Reviews.Author: BarLaf
Reviews.Content: Me and my fiance had a great time in this hotel. The staff was a great help with telling us were to go in Montreal. The room was beautiful with a big bathroom. The view on the city was nice. Everything was clean. The parking is free, and we could leave the car there until 6pm the next day, no extra charge!

Reviews.Title: “Okay hotel, Room Average”
Reviews.Author: luckychris101
Reviews.Content: The area is close enough to tourist attractions but not great. We had to walk through some questionable apartment complex streets to get to the main tourist restaurant drag. Self-parking was easy in the underground parking garage with in and out privileges. The service personnel were all very friendly. However, when we asked for opinions of things or restaurants to visit, we were sent to the concierge, but it was always the bellman who referred us to a limited selection of brochures. The room was larger than expected with a strange layout. There was a balcony but very wet from rain. The room was musty smelling but looked clean upon inspection. Overall it was pretty average.

Reviews.Title: “The Non-Smoking Room SCAM Continues”
Reviews.Author: ttarbllib
Reviews.Content: Disappointed in not finding a non-smoking room (who sells smoking rooms anymore in Canada!?!?!), I was charged an extra $20 per room (2 rooms) under the same pretense as another online complaint. While there were no non-smoking rooms available at the room type that I had purchased through Priceline, there were plenty of non-smoking rooms available for upgraded rooms. The whole experience left me feeling disgusted and I have now written Priceline for a refund. I'll follow up with the Delta head office as well. Do yourself a favour, the Delta Montreal was nothing to write home about in the first place, if you want to be ripped off....look for another place!! Bill

Reviews.Title: “Worst of the worst”
Reviews.Author: Lun100
Reviews.Content: I have never written a review and I thought I would never, but after stayed in this Montreal Delta (475 Avenue Du PrÃ©sident-Kennedy), I have to. This is top of my worst experience in a so called 4 star hotel : First, once we enter the room, my kids found some dirty beer caps still on the floor, room was not properly clean, and they almost hurt their feets, lucky my boy still had his socks on! And about 15 minutes later, 2 other guests just entered our room in the middle of our changing our clothes, we called front desk and they said will send someone a set of new access cards right away. After 3 hours, nobody showed up and I tried to called more than 10 times in between to the front desk and no one answers. Finally, I have to try to call the operator and connect to the front desk and after a long ring, someone answered and send us the new access cards. When I told me about how the room condition to the staff, all she said was "OH!" Very bad service and experience and I very close to check out but was very tired after been travel almost a week ahead before Montreal, our last destination of the trip. I have been in Montreal over dozens of times and this was the first time I stayed in Delta Montreal and I will never never stay in Montreal Delta again even they pay me for it!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: WrldTrvlGrl
Reviews.Content: We only paid $99 a night which is a good price for this hotel. I definitely wouldn't pay the regular price of $189. The rooms are a decent size and clean. The beds are pillow top mattresses so they are quite comfortable. The bathroom is typical for a hotel. This hotel does have balconies which is nice. Some rooms have decent views if you are up high enough. The location is convient because you can walk everywhere. The only issues are the expensive parking at $23/night, and the elevators. There are only 3 for 25 floors so it can get a bit ridiculous having to wait if you're higher up. The pool, gym and squash courts seem ok, but we didn't use them.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of Priceline Scam!”
Reviews.Author: Kahbooom
Reviews.Content: I booked the Delta property through Priceline and received a great rate of 70 dollars a night. I had read previous posts that travelers who had booked on priceline were told when they checked in that the hotel was sold out and to receive a nonsmoking room they could pay an additional 20 dollar charge. I was armed with this knowledge when I checked in. Upon check-in I was also told that the hotel was completely sold out and that in order to receive a nonsmoking room I must pay 20 dollars. They even had a laminated copy of the priceline policy to show me as I complained. I of course paid the 20 dollars and went to my room. The "upgraded" room was a little worn and dated. The wallpaper was coming off the wall and there were cracks in the balcony. I proceeded to call the hotel manager to express my disdain for the 20 dollar fee for the upgraded room. The manager, Genevieve was completely unfriendly and explained again that the hotel was sold out and she was not going to do anything about the fee. I then called reservations to try and book a room at this sold out property. I was told there were plenty of rooms available at the 400 plus room hotel. Hmmmm. Then I called the Delta customer service number that I found in the room and explained the situation and how the staff were lying to us regarding of the sold out status of the hotel. She was outraged and within 30 minutes she had called the hotel spoken with the aforementioned Genevieve. We had the 20 dollar fee removed from our bill, two free buffet breakfasts for the next morning, a bottle of Bordeaux and chocolates were also sent up to the room. They were busted with their priceline scam. It is an ok hotel and worth 70 dollars. If you do book on priceline be prepared to fight that 20 dollar charge! I'm sure they are still. doing it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: RaeJay
Reviews.Content: Of course not knowing what Hotel I was getting because I booked through Hotwire I was a little nervous. I'd read some not so positive reviews about this hotel, but I decided to see for myself. We took the train into Montreal so our hotel was about a 20 minute walk from the station (5 minutes if you take the metro to McGill). The front lobby was clean and brightly lit and there was a gentleman at the front to offer advice on travelling around montreal. The front staff were pleasant and had no trouble speaking to me in English (my french is quite poor, I didn't want to embarrass myself by even trying), our room was on the 4th floor and had 2 double beds. My first thought was "this hotel has so much space and doesn't know what to do with it". My only complaint was the room smelled like it had been smoked in before, but it wasn't a strong smell. We didn't venture on to the balcony, but there was quite a bit of space there as well. I had an excellent time at this hotel, it was clean, spacious and the staff were really friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Long Weekend Stay”
Reviews.Author: Micknyny
Reviews.Content: The Delta Hotel was excellent. The room was well-appointed, clean, great bed & linens, and nice balcony (great view of Mont Royal). Moreover, the staff was great and very accommodating. My partner and I had an excellent 4 night weekend stay. The hotel is outstanding and lived up to expectations. We paid a bit more for a "Signature Room" which included access to a top-floor hospitality suite for breakfast and happy hour. Both were worth the little extra in room rate. I must emphasize the staff were outstanding & made us feel at home ... & made me remember why I love Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location”
Reviews.Author: ny_murray
Reviews.Content: We booked our room through Hotwire and after reading the reviews here, were unsure of what to expect. The check-in staff tried to put us in a smoking room but when we requested a non-smoking,she quickly re-assigned us to a non-smoking room. Our room felt spacious and was clean, although the TV could be updated. It must have been one of the renovated rooms. The pool is an odd trapezoid shape which makes it unsuitable to swim laps. The location was convenient -- within walking distance from the train station and also there is an underground connection to the metro. There are plenty of restaurants right around the corner but you would never know from asking the concierge. The concierge tries to steer you to the shops/restaurants within the hotel. This is annoying. Free internet and breakfast are not included, and wireless is not available in the room. But for the price we got, we would probably go back.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for the money....”
Reviews.Author: RainbowTrvlr
Reviews.Content: The Delta Montreal is located squarely in Downtown Montreal and VERY close to the METRO and an easy starting point for just about any field trip you can imagin in Montreal. The hotel is clean, well staffed and equipped. Overall, a good value for the money (depending on your rate). HOTEL OVERVIEW: The facilities are good. Arrival was painless. First impression of the hotel was clean and well maintained with an attractive lobby area that was well marked with signs and easily managed with luggage. Parking was easy (we self-parked) and came right up the elevator into the hotel lobby from the inside. Front Desk staff were pleasant and friendly and assisted with everything we needed upon arrival. We took up our own bags so bell-service was not used (nor offered oddly enough). ROOM: I was on the 19th Floor in a superior room, smoking with two full-sized bed (room 1919). The room was a good size for two people but I could not imagine a family of four being comfortable. The little balcony was great but it needed a could of chairs and a small table so your could enjoy it. I would have loved to sit out there and have breakfast and a coffee but there is not furniture out there. There was only one chair in the room due to the space limitations obviously. I think King rooms have two chairs. The photos are size-misleading so that was a surprise. The overall impression was that the room was dated (except for the beds). The green carpeting, old style TV and mis-matched, falling apart lamps that were chipped and wobbly gave the impression of a motel decor rather than a full-service hotel. The furniture, decor and fixtures could use a soft-goods upgrade. The bed was extremely comfortable so that was a nice surprise. The bathroom was dated as well with formica counters, 70's sink, bad lighting and tub/shower combination. Maybe I've gotten spoiled but it also gave the impression of a motel bathroom (utilitarian and clean but not much else). FACILITIES: We went swimming and used the hot tub in the pool area. It was clean, well maintained and pleasant to use. I didn't use the gym part so I can't comment on that. We stopped by the spa and looked around. It was well staffed but a bit overpriced ($30 CD for a manicure) but if you need a service, they have it available. STAFF: We used the Concierge a few times but often his suggestions failed to impress. The first night we asked for something close and he sent us to an Italian restaurant around the corner. While close, the food was not very good but okay. He was unfamiliar with a few restaurants I asked about (Les Halles is one example). He also stated that the buffet at the casino was open 24/7 however that also was not the case as they stop serving at 10:30PM. One would expect he would know that, as well as other details about major tourist attractions. He had to look online for restaurants, ect. which lead me to believe he lacked personal knowledge of a good concierge and instead relied on the internet or a program to guide his suggestions. The housekeeping staff and reception staff were all friendly and helpful. I was pleased on both ends with their service and friendly hello. Overall, I would return to the Delta Montreal but only if the rate was good (we paid $166 per night AAA rate). They didn't WOW me in any particular way but they didn't turn me off either. I would only suggest they upgrade/update the rooms to match the public areas of the hotel, train their concierges and allow more personal experience with tourist areas and restaurants so their advice is from personal experience and not a computer program used to guide them.

Reviews.Title: “Love the information”
Reviews.Author: nan315
